titleStmt.title: A good help for weak memories, or, The contents of every chapter in the Bible in alphabetical dysticks being very profitable for such as desire to repeat books or find out divers places in the Scripture, especially in the historical books : whereunto is added the order of times wherein the prophesies and New Testament were penned : and a chronology from Adam to the destruction of Jerusalem by Titus Vespasian : with other Scriptural passages made easie to be remembred.

projectDesc.p: Created by converting TCP files to TEI P5 using tcp2tei.xsl, TEI @ Oxford.

editorialDecl.p: EEBO-TCP is a partnership between the Universities of Michigan and Oxford and the publisher ProQuest to create accurately transcribed and encoded texts based on the image sets published by ProQuest via their Early English Books Online (EEBO) database (http://eebo.chadwyck.com). The general aim of EEBO-TCP is to encode one copy (usually the first edition) of every monographic English-language title published between 1473 and 1700 available in EEBO.

EEBO-TCP aimed to produce large quantities of textual data within the usual project restraints of time and funding, and therefore chose to create diplomatic transcriptions (as opposed to critical editions) with light-touch, mainly structural encoding based on the Text Encoding Initiative (http://www.tei-c.org).

The EEBO-TCP project was divided into two phases. The 25,368 texts created during Phase 1 of the project (2000-2009), initially available only to institutions that contributed to their creation, were released into the public domain on 1 January 2015. The approximately 40,000 texts produced during Phase 2 (2009- ), of which 34,963 had been released as of 2020, originally similarly restricted, were similarly freed from all restrictions on 1 August 2020. As of that date anyone is free to take and use these texts for any purpose (modify them, annotate them, distribute them, etc.). But we do respectfully request that due credit and attribution be given to their original source.
Users should be aware of the process of creating the TCP texts, and therefore of any assumptions that can be made about the data.

Text selection was based on the New Cambridge Bibliography of English Literature (NCBEL). If an author (or for an anonymous work, the title) appears in NCBEL, then their works are eligible for inclusion. Selection was intended to range over a wide variety of subject areas, to reflect the true nature of the print record of the period. In general, first editions of a works in English were prioritized, although there are a number of works in other languages, notably Latin and Welsh, included and sometimes a second or later edition of a work was chosen if there was a compelling reason to do so.

Image sets were sent to external keying companies for transcription and basic encoding. Quality assurance was then carried out by editorial teams in Oxford and Michigan. 5% (or 5 pages, whichever is the greater) of each text was proofread for accuracy and those which did not meet QA standards were returned to the keyers to be redone. After proofreading, the encoding was enhanced and/or corrected and characters marked as illegible were corrected where possible up to a limit of 100 instances per text. Any remaining illegibles were encoded as <gap>s. Understanding these processes should make clear that, while the overall quality of TCP data is very good, some errors will remain and some readable characters will be marked as illegible. Users should bear in mind that in all likelihood such instances will never have been looked at by a TCP editor.
The texts were encoded and linked to page images in accordance with level 4 of the TEI in Libraries guidelines.

Copies of the texts have been issued variously as SGML (TCP schema; ASCII text with mnemonic sdata character entities); displayable XML (TCP schema; characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or text strings within braces); or lossless XML (TEI P5, characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or TEI g elements).
Keying and markup guidelines are available at the Text Creation Partnership web site.

div.p: A good help for weak Memories: Or, the CONTENTS Of every CHAPTER In the Bible In Alphabetical Dyſticks. Being very profitable for ſuch as deſire to repeat Books, or find out divers places in the Scriptures, eſpecially in the Hiſtorical BOOKS. Whereunto is added the Order of Times wherein the Propheſies and New TESTAMENT were penned. As alſo A CHRONOLOGY from ADAM to the deſtruction of Jeruſalem by Titus Veſpaſian. With other Scriptural Paſſages made eaſie to be remembred.
LONDON, Printed for Thomas Helder, at the Sign of the Angel in Little Britain. 1671.

div.head: To the Reader.
div.p: MEeting long ſince with a little Latine Book, called Gemma Fabri, being Alphabetical Dyſticks upon the Bible, I was ſtrongly perſwaded, that ſomething of that nature in Engliſh, would be very profitable towards the remembring, repeating, and finding out of places of Scriptures, eſpecially of the Hiſtorical part. This moved me to prevail with ſome (whom I found inclined to Poetry) to ſpend their ſpare minutes this way, and to contribute mine own mite to the perfecting of what is now come (by Gods aſſiſtance) to their view; wherein if thou expecteſt a Poetical flaſh, thou wilt be diſappointed; neither is it poſſible, where a perſon is tied to matter, Laconick brevity, and initiating Letters.

Poſſibly the benefit of this tract may not
appear to thy firſt glance: be not diſcouraged, labour to hit the deſign, and thou mayſt find the book anſwering its Title: for thy help take theſe few directions, as a Key to it.

1. Are you deſirous to have a Boy or Girl, of ten years or upwards, to tell you in what Chapter any Hiſtorical paſſage is, let him read one Chapter every day in order, and learn the Dyſtick (or two lines) which are the Contents thereof. When he hath learned twenty Dyſticks or more, examine him of particular paſſages in the Chapters he hath paſt; as in what Chapter is ſet forth Sarahs barrenneſs: he preſently calls to mind this Dyſtick:
Quell'd's Sarahs hope of Seed; Hagar doth ſcorn
Her Miſtreſs, flies, returns: Iſhmael's born.
He conſidereth that (Q) is the firſt letter in the Dyſtick, which is the ſixteenth in the Chriſt-croſs-row; thence he concludes it muſt be in the ſixteenth, or thirty ſixth Chapter of Geneſis.
I have known two children, who by this eaſie task, in half a years time, would hardly miſs any Hiſtorical paſſage from the firſt of Geneſis to the end of Ruth.

2. Will you find ſome Hiſtorical paſſage, and cannot ſay theſe Verſes by heart; as the churliſhneſs of Nabal, &c. your acquaintance with the Scriptures aſſures you it is in the firſt book of Samuel; then turn to the verſes which contain the contents of that book, and you ſhall find it aſſoon as in a Concordance, and many times ſooner; this I know to be a truth upon mine own experience.
3. Will you cull out a Pſalm upon ſome particular occaſion, read over the verſes which contain the ſubſtance of the Pſalms, until you meet with what you ſeek for.

4. Would you teach a Child or Servant a Scripture againſt ſome common ſin, as drunkenneſs, lying, &c. or in praiſe of
ſome moral virtue or duty; read over the Verſes on the Proverbs, &c. and you will ſoon have your deſire.
5. Do you deſire to have your youth to repeat the Hiſtory of any book in the Bible in order? Let him read it with deliberation, and learn the verſes on that book, and he will do it to your content.

Time and experience may furniſh you with other advantages: I have no more but to requeſt your charitable interpretation of what the importunity of many hath made publike. If this anſwer not your expectation, the loſs cannot be much: If it prove any way beneficial to you or yours, the end is anſwered: Let him have your Prayers, who is

closer.signed: Your friend in the Lord, J. L.

lg.l: CHapters and Pſalms within the Book Divine,
Are one thouſand, one hundred, eighty nine.
The Chapters in th' Old Teſtament amount
To ſev'n hundred ſev'nty nine, by account:
Beſides the Pſalms, one hundred fifty more;
The New Teſtament comes to thirteen ſcore.

div.p: Teſtamentum Vetus. GEn. Exod. Lev. Num. Deut. Joſh. Jud. Ruth. Sam. Reg. Chron. Ezr. Neh. Eſth. Job. Pſal. Prov. Eccleſ. Cant. Iſa. Jer. Thre. Eze. Dan. Hoſh. Joel. Am. Obad. Jon. Mic. Nab. Habak. Zeph. Hag. Zechar. Malac.
Teſtamentum Novum. MAt. Mar. Luc. Joan. Act. Rom. Cor. Gal. Epheſ. Phil. Col. Theſ. Tim. Tit. Phil. Heb. Jac. Pet. Joan. Jud. Apocalypſis.
Jacobs Twelve Sons. REuben; Sim. Levi. Jud. Dan. Gad, Aſher, Nepht, Zebulon, Joſeph, Ben. Iſſachar.
The Ten Plagues of Egypt. EGypts ten Plagues: Blood, Frogs, Lice, Flies, Murrain, Boils, Hail, Locuſts, Darkneſs, the firſt-born ſlain.

lg.head: The Twelve Apoſtles.
lg.l: JOhn, Andrew, Philip, Thomas, Barth'lomew,
Two James'es, Simons, Judas'es, Matthew.

body.head: A GOOD HELP FOR WEAK MEMORIES.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: ALl's made in ſix days, Heav'n, Earth, Light, Seas vaſt:
Sun, Moon, Stars, Fiſh, Fowls, Beaſts, and Man at laſt.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: Bleſt is the Sabbath, Woman formed, Man
in Eden placed; wedlock there began.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Craft of the Serpent, Mans fall wrought, all curſt.
A Saviour promis'd. Man from Eden thruſt.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Driv'n by pale envy, Cain doth Abel kill,
is curſt. His ſeed the Land of Nod doth fill.

lg.label: chapter 5
lg.l: Each Patriarchs Line and Age from Adam to
Noah, Enochs tranſlation alſo.

lg.label: chapter 6
lg.l: Flouds of ſin cauſe the Lord the Floud to ſend;
Noah finds Grace; th' Arks meaſure, form, & end.

lg.label: chapter 7
lg.l: Good Noah with ſome of all fleſh God hides
i'th Ark: the floud comes; how long it abides.

lg.label: chapter 8
lg.l: High flouds aſſwage: Raven, & Dove, go forth;
then Noah; God his off'ring takes in worth.

lg.label: chapter 9
lg.l: Jah bleſſeth him, his Covenant by Rainbow
confirms: Noah is drunk, Cham curſt alſo.

lg.label: chapter 10
lg.l: Knowledg of Noahs race is given, when
Nimrod is noted for oppreſſing men.

lg.label: chapter 11
lg.l: Language one: Babel built, confuſion hatcht.
Shems Line. Terahs remove. Abra'm is matcht.

lg.label: chapter 12
lg.l: March Abra'm doth with Lot to Canaan, given
of God. Denies his wife to Egypt driven.

lg.label: chapter 13
lg.l: Now both return, diſſent; part Lot doth chuſe
Sodom: God Abra'ms Covenant renews.

lg.label: chapter 14
lg.l: Of ſpoils from Kings (Lot reſcu'd;) Abram bleſt,
pays Tythes; To Sodoms King reſtores the reſt.

lg.label: chapter 15
lg.l: Promis'd a Son, Abra'm believes thereon:
Canaan confirm'd by ſign and viſion.

lg.label: chapter 16
lg.l: Quell'd's Sarahs hope of Seed; Hagar doth ſcorn
her Miſtreſs, flies, returns; Iſhmael's born.

lg.label: chapter 17
lg.l: Renew'd the Covenant; Circumciſion
Ordain'd and perform'd; Iſaac promis'd thereon

lg.label: chapter 18
lg.l: Sarah laughs, is reprov'd: three Angels tell
of Sodoms fall: Abram to prayer fell.

lg.label: chapter 19
lg.l: Two Angels reſcue Lot: his wife's turn'd ſalt.
His Daughters make him drunk: Inceſt's his fault.

lg.label: chapter 20
lg.l: Vain fear makes Abra'm Sarah to deny;
checkt is Abimelech, ſhe's reſtor'd thereby.

lg.label: chapter 21
lg.l: A Son hath Sarah: Iſhmael doth taunt:
Hagar's caſt out: Beerſheba's Covenant.

lg.label: chapter 22
lg.l: By Gods Angel ſtopt is Iſaacs Oblation:
Obedience bleſt; and Nahors Generation.

lg.label: chapter 23
lg.l: Concerning Sarahs death, age, burial;
Machpelahs purchaſe is related all.

lg.label: chapter 24
lg.l: Drawn from his Kinred, as by his Oath ti'd,
Abrahams ſteward brings Iſaac a Bride.

lg.label: chapter 25
lg.l: Eye here Keturahs Sons, and Iſhmaels:
Abra'ms death; Eſau born, his Birth-right ſells.

lg.label: chapter 26
lg.l: Fear forceth Iſaac to diſown his wife:
The King's forbidden her: a Well breeds ſtrife.

lg.label: chapter 27
lg.l: 'Guiled by clothes, and tale, Iſaac doth bleſs
Jacob; Eſau doth threat: prevented is.

lg.label: chapter 28
lg.l: Here Jacobs bleſt, to Laban ſent. Eſau
Is matched. Jacobs Ladder, Pillow, Vow.

lg.label: chapter 29
lg.l: Jacob to Laban comes, ſerves fourteen years
For his two Daughters; Leah four Sons bears.

lg.label: chapter 30
lg.l: Known's Jacobs hire, craft, wealth, Reubens Mandrakes:
Eight children more. The Concubines he takes.

lg.label: chapter 31
lg.l: Laban diſpleas'd; Jacob parts; God doth take
his part, curbs Laban; They a Covenant make.

lg.label: chapter 32
lg.l: Meſſengers Jacob to Eſau doth hie:
Prays, Wreſtleth with an Angel, halts on's thigh.

lg.label: chapter 33
lg.l: Now Eſau Jacob meets, kiſſeth, and takes
gifts. Jacob at Shalem an Altar makes.

lg.label: chapter 34
lg.l: Of Dinahs Rape: Sechemites overthrow
by Jacobs Sons; Jacob doth angry grow.

lg.label: chapter 35
lg.l: Purg'd's Jacobs houſe; at Bethel he is bleſt:
Rachels, and Iſaacs death. Reubens Inceſt.

lg.label: chapter 36
lg.l: Quietly ſeiz'd of Scir, Eſau lives.
His Progeny to Kings and Dukes birth gives.

lg.label: chapter 37
lg.l: Raging at Joſephs Dreams, his Brethren ſell
him, grieve their Sire: In Aegypt he doth dwell.

lg.label: chapter 38
lg.l: Slain Judahs Sons are: Onan ſpills his ſeed:
Judah threats Thamar: Zarah hath red thread.

lg.label: chapter 39
lg.l: Tempted is Joſeph; ſhuns his Miſtreſs luſt:
falſly accus'd is into priſon thruſt.

lg.label: chapter 40
lg.l: Unfold two Dreams doth Joſeph: Pharaohs feaſt:
The Butler him forgetteth when releaſt.

lg.label: chapter 41
lg.l: Advanc'd by Pharaohs Dreams Joſeph doth ſtore
up Corn. His Sons. Begun's a famine ſore.

lg.label: chapter 42
lg.l: By dearth Jacobs Sons forc'd to Aegypt are:
Shut up, freed, how, returned they declare.

lg.label: chapter 43
lg.l: Conſtrain'd by famine, Ben: is ſent; ſet free
is Simeon: they by Joſeph feaſted be.

lg.label: chapter 44
lg.l: Deviſe doth Joſeph Benjamin to ſtay:
Judah would be his pledge; Joſeph ſaith nay.

lg.label: chapter 45
lg.l: Each Brother weeps when Joſeph makes him known:
Chariots are ſent to bring old Jacob down.

lg.label: chapter 46
lg.l: From Canaan Jacob ſteers, God's his conduct:
Joſeph meets him; his Brethren doth inſtruct.

lg.label: chapter 47
lg.l: Goods, Lands all (Prieſt's excepted) Joſeph gains:
Jacob ſees Pharaoh, Rameſes obtains.

lg.label: chapter 48
lg.l: His ſick Sire Joſeph with his ſons doth ſee:
are bleſt; to Canaan their return ſhews he.

lg.label: chapter 49
lg.l: Jacob foretells his ſons their deſtinies.
in Canaan will interr'd be; ſhortly dies.

lg.label: chapter 50
lg.l: Kinde's Joſeph at this burial; Propheſies;
his age; takes Oath about his bones, and dies.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: A New King reigns. Jacobs growth is his hate.
His helliſh plot: Midwives; the Infants fate.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: Born and hid Moſes is; preſerv'd, maintaind:
Flies; Marries: Iſraels cries God's audience gain'd.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Confirm'd by burning buſh, and by Gods Name,
Moſes is ſent their freedom for to claim.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Drawn by ſigns, he to Aegypt goes; his ſon
doth Circumciſe: Is helped by Aaron.

lg.label: chapter 5
lg.l: Encreaſe of bondage makes Hebrews complain
to Moſes, Aaron; they to God again.

lg.label: chapter 6
lg.l: Firming his promiſe by Jehovahs Name,
God ſtrengthneth Moſes, he from Levi came.

lg.label: chapter 7
lg.l: Gods Meſſage Moſes to Pharaoh delivers:
his Rod turn'd Serpent, into blood the Rivers.

lg.label: chapter 8
lg.l: Here Frogs, Lice, Flies are ſent, but all in vain:
Pharaoh bids go, recalls his word again.

lg.label: chapter 9
lg.l: In fields the Murrain is, among men Boils:
The Hail all Aegypt (ſave Rameſes) ſpoils.

lg.label: chapter 10
lg.l: Knowledg nor ſenſe of Plagues breaks the intent
of Pharaohs will: Locuſts, and Darkneſs ſent.

lg.label: chapter 11
lg.l: Loan of th' Aegyptians Jewels Hebrews gain:
Aegypts firſt born are threatned to be ſlain.

lg.label: chapter 12
lg.l: Moſes appoints the Paſſeover that night:
The firſt-born ſlain; forc'd out is th' Iſraelite.

lg.label: chapter 13
lg.l: Now the firſt-born to God are ſanctifi'd:
Pillars of Cloud and Fire the Hebrews guide.

lg.label: chapter 14
lg.l: Orders for Iſraels Journey: Pharaohs Hoſt
purſues; the forces are in th'Red Sea loſt.

lg.label: chapter 15
lg.l: Praiſed is God in ſong: Marah's made ſweet:
At Elim twelve wells, and palm-trees, they meet.

lg.label: chapter 16
lg.l: Quails, Manna ſent, Murmuring to appeaſe;
Manna rain'd ſix dayes, on the ſeventh doth ceaſe.

lg.label: chapter 17
lg.l: Rock Horeb yields to murmuring Jacob water:
Joſhuah Amalek doth vanquiſh, ſcatter.

lg.label: chapter 18
lg.l: Sage Jethro brings his wife and ſons to Moſes:
his joy and counſel; Moſes with it cloſes.

lg.label: chapter 19
lg.l: To Sinai Iſrael comes, are hallowed there;
may not the Mount touch; they Gods preſence fear.

lg.label: chapter 20
lg.l: View here the Law. All Iſrael is amaz'd:
Moſes comes near, by him an Altar's rais'd.

lg.label: chapter 21
lg.l: Acts for men-ſtealers, ſlayers, and nuſance:
for ſervants, parent-curſers, hurts by chance.

lg.label: chapter 22
lg.l: Borr'wing, theft, dammage, treſpaſs, beſtiality,
oppreſſion, whoredom, witchcraft, pledg, idolatry:

lg.label: chapter 23
lg.l: Caſes of Juſtice, mercy, year of reſt:
falſe witneſs, Sabbath, feaſts: Obedience bleſt.

lg.label: chapter 24
lg.l: Days fourty Moſes on the Mount doth ſtay:
T'obey they promiſe: Aaron, Hur, them ſway,

lg.label: chapter 25
lg.l: Each freely offer'd gift Moſes muſt take,
things for the Sanctuaries uſe to make.

lg.label: chapter 26
lg.l: Forms for the coverings, boards, vail, here mark,
of Tabernacle, Mercy-ſeat, and Ark.

lg.label: chapter 27
lg.l: God for the Altar veſſels, lamp, oyl, and
the Court of Tabernacle gives command.

lg.label: chapter 28
lg.l: Habits for Aaron and his Sons to wear;
the Urim, Breſt-plate, Ephod fall in here.

lg.label: chapter 29
lg.l: In conſecrating Prieſts a form is ſhown:
the daily off'ring; God dwels with his own.

lg.label: chapter 30
lg.l: Known here's the incenſe-altar, Souls ranſome▪
Braſs lavers, holy Oyl, and ſweet perfume.

lg.label: chapter 31
lg.l: Largely Bezaleel the Lord enables
for holy work; Moſes receives the Tables.

lg.label: chapter 32
lg.l: Moſes Gods wrath, by Calf enflam'd, allays,
the Tables breaks; Idolaters he ſlays.

lg.label: chapter 33
lg.l: No longer God will lead the Iſraelite;
they mourn: of God Moſes deſires a ſight.

lg.label: chapter 34
lg.l: Of Gods deſcription, Covenant-Tables new:
Moſes bright face, till vail'd, they cannot view.

lg.label: chapter 35
lg.l: Preſents are brought for Tabernacles uſe:
the Sabbath: God again doth carvers chuſe.

lg.label: chapter 36
lg.l: Quitted they are from off'ring more; and all
left to the workmens care, to work they fall.

lg.label: chapter 37
lg.l: Richly are made Ark, Table, Mercy-ſeat,
Candle-ſtick; Altar, oyl, and Incenſe ſweet.

lg.label: chapter 38
lg.l: Sums of the peoples offrings here are named;
Burnt-offering-Altar, court, braſs laver, framed.

lg.label: chapter 39
lg.l: To Prieſts are holy garments made; all ended,
Moſes them view'd, and upon view commended.

lg.label: chapter 40
lg.l: Uprear'd's the Tabernacle, and annointed;
hallow'd the Prieſts. All's done as God appointed.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: ALl Burnt-off'rings of herds, flocks, fowls, and how
to be performed, doth this Chapter ſhew.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: Baked and fri'd meat-offrings, and their kinde;
with the firſt fruits. Their duties are aſſign'd.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Clear from all blemiſh peace-off'rings muſt be,
whether of lamb or goat, an he or ſhe.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Directed are Prieſts, people, rulers all,
who into ſin of ignorance do fall.

lg.label: chapter 5
lg.l: Each offering for truth-concealing, ſwearing,
unclean-thing touching, ſacriledge not fearing:

lg.label: chapter 6
lg.l: For ſins of knowledge, burnt, meat, ſin-off'rings:
and conſecrating Prieſts, Laws in all things.

lg.label: chapter 7
lg.l: Ordred by Law, blood is forbidden ſtill.

lg.label: chapter 8
lg.l: Hallow'd the ram, ſin-off'ring, burnt oblation:
the time and place of Aarons conſecration.

lg.label: chapter 9
lg.l: In this his firſt gift for himſelf, and all:
the Camp bleſt. Fire doth on the Altar fall.

lg.label: chapter 10
lg.l: Kill'd Nad ab and Abihu are with fire
from heav'n; Prieſts drinking wine kindle Gods ire.

lg.label: chapter 11
lg.l: Learn here what Creatures clean and unclean be,
what may be eaten, what forborn by thee.

lg.label: chapter 12
lg.l: Mark here how women purified be
after their Child-birth; their oblations ſee.

lg.label: chapter 13
lg.l: Noted are here the Laws of leproſie;
the ſigns whereby the Prieſts that grief may ſpy.

lg.label: chapter 14
lg.l: Off'red are rules, to know, and what to do
to cure this grief in men, and houſes too.

lg.label: chapter 15
lg.l: Polluted with unclean iſſues both men
and women are, the way to make them clean.

lg.label: chapter 16
lg.l: Queſtions of High-prieſts entring holy place:
the time reſolv'd; his off'ring, ſcape-goats race.

lg.label: chapter 17
lg.l: Rules here of killing off'rings, and of blood:
off'ring to Devils, carrion-fleſh not good.

lg.label: chapter 18
lg.l: Some Marriages and luſts unlawful be;
Inceſt, adultery, and Sodomy.

lg.label: chapter 19
lg.l: Toucht at again here divers ſtatutes are,
to help the memory, and increaſe the care.

lg.label: chapter 20
lg.l: Wizarding, parent-curſing, off'ring ſeed
to Molech, of ſtrange luſts, the doom here read.

lg.label: chapter 21
lg.l: A law for prieſts mourning, wives, daughters, ſee;
his worth; no blemiſht-perſon prieſt may be.

lg.label: chapter 22
lg.l: Being unclean, prieſts holy things abſtain;
the age, nature, of Sacrifices ſlain.

lg.label: chapter 23
lg.l: Commanded here are many feſtivals:
the harveſt gleanings the poor muſt have all.

lg.label: chapter 24
lg.l: Dammage laws, murther, holy lamps and cakes;
blaſphemy's puniſht, for Ben Shelomiths ſake.

lg.label: chapter 25
lg.l: Each ſeventh year Sabbath, year of Jubilee;
Mercy to poor, oppreſſion, uſury.

lg.label: chapter 26
lg.l: Faithful obedience with bliſs is crown'd;
Law-breakers God, with curſes, will confound;

lg.label: chapter 27
lg.l: God vow'd things claims, redeem them no man may:
The tithes muſt not be chang'd; all muſt them pay.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: A Sum of Tribes and Princes Moſes brings.
Levy exempted is for holy things.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: Brave Marſhal order of their Tents here ſee:
Standards with Enſigns of their Pedigree.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Come ſee Aarons and Levies Pedigree:
The firſt-born freed, and Levites Prieſts muſt be.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Deſcrib'd's the age, time, and charge of Levites,
Prieſt, Cohathites, Gerſhonites, Merarites.

lg.label: chapter 5
lg.l: Expell'd Lepers and others for pollution:
Jealouſie tri'd; for wrongs juſt reſtitution.

lg.label: chapter 6
lg.l: Fram'd is the Nazarites Law, and how they came;
the form of bleſſing people in Gods Name.

lg.label: chapter 7
lg.l: Great are the Princes off'rings, when compleat
are Tabernacle, Ark, and Mercy-ſeat.

lg.label: chapter 8
lg.l: How lamps are lighted, Levites conſecration,
the time, and age of them in holy ſtation.

lg.label: chapter 9
lg.l: Jehovah Paſch commands; a Cloud doth guide
Iſr'el. At Gods command they march, abide.

lg.label: chapter 10
lg.l: Know ſilver Trumpets uſe. Paran receives
Iſr'el: their march, order; them Hobab leaves.

lg.label: chapter 11
lg.l: Loathing of Manna, Tab'raes burning call:
Seventy help Moſes; Quails from heaven fall.

lg.label: chapter 12
lg.l: Miriam's a leper, Moſes prays, heal'd ſhe
is, but out of the Hoſt ſeven days muſt be.

lg.label: chapter 13
lg.l: Nam'd are the men ſent to ſpy out the land:
th'inſtructions; ſpies report how things do ſtand.

lg.label: chapter 14
lg.l: Offence is taken at the Spies report;
God threats, Moſes doth pray; God plagues them for't.

lg.label: chapter 15
lg.l: Preſumptions penance; off'ring Laws are here:
The Sabbath-breaker ſton'd; Arms they muſt bear.

lg.label: chapter 16
lg.l: Quick, murmuring Core with his Sect, earth doth cover;
thouſands by plagues die, e're Gods wrath paſs over.

lg.label: chapter 17
lg.l: Rods for each Tribe are laid up before God:
Gods choice is ſhewn by Aarons budding Rod.

lg.label: chapter 18
lg.l: Shewn are the Prieſts and Levites charge & due;
the heave-off'rings unto the Prieſts accrue.

lg.label: chapter 19
lg.l: The ſeparation-water, with the rite
of purifying the unclean by it.

lg.label: chapter 20
lg.l: Water from Rock ſlows: Aaron, Miriam die:
Edom, their paſſage, through his land, deny.

lg.label: chapter 21
lg.l: Arad ſubdu'd; the ſtung are healed all
by brazen Serpent: Og and Sihon fall.

lg.label: chapter 22
lg.l: Balaam to Balak goes. An Angel breaks
his way: he beats his aſs, the dumb aſs ſpeaks.

lg.label: chapter 23
lg.l: Curs'd Balak with gifts and ſeven Altars would
get Balaam curſe Gods people, if he could.

lg.label: chapter 24
lg.l: Diſmiſs doth Balak, Balaam in a rage,
for bleſſing Jacob; he doth Chriſt preſage.

lg.label: chapter 25
lg.l: Ephraim doth idolize, and whore: two die.
Midian muſt vext be. Phineas bleſt thereby.

lg.label: chapter 26
lg.l: Full ſum of Iſr'el's drawn in Moabs plain:
of all (firſt ſummon'd) Joſh'ah, Caleb remain.

lg.label: chapter 27
lg.l: Giv'n to Zelophehads Daughters is his land:
when Moſes dies, Joſh'ah muſt bear command.

lg.label: chapter 28
lg.l: Holocauſts daily; what on Sabbath-day,
New Moons, Paſch, firſt-fruit days be offer'd may,

lg.label: chapter 29
lg.l: In feaſts of Trumpets, and a ſolemn faſt,
Read here; and feaſt of Tabernacles laſt.

lg.label: chapter 30
lg.l: Know of mens, maids, wives, widows vows, the force;
of hers alſo who is under divorce.

lg.label: chapter 31
lg.l: Lewd Midian's ſtroy'd: Moſes bids, wives, whores ſlay;
Souldiers are taught to purge, divide the prey.

lg.label: chapter 32
lg.l: Manaſſes half Tribe, Reuben, and Gad crave
Sihons and Ogs land; them on terms they have.

lg.label: chapter 33
lg.l: Nam'd are the Journeys of the Iſraelites:
God gives command deſtroy the Canaanites.

lg.label: chapter 34
lg.l: Of Canaans borders read here round about,
their names who do divide and ſet it out.

lg.label: chapter 35
lg.l: Pointed are Levites towns, whereof twice three
for refuge; murder may not thence ſcape free.

lg.label: chapter 36
lg.l: Queſtion'd are Zelophehads Daughters match:
Heireſſes in their Tribes muſt Husbands catch.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: AT fourt' years end, is ſhewn how Rulers were
made; Spies report; God plagues diſtruſtful fear.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: By Lots ſeed they might paſs, and Edomite,
untoucht. Heſhbons King Sihon they ſhall ſmite.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Conqueſt of Og; his bed. Reuben, Gads lot:
Moſes may Canaan ſee, enter may not.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Divers Laws muſt be kept: no Idols made:
here's Motives. Refuge Towns in Gilead.

lg.label: chapter 5
lg.l: Exceſs of fear makes them ſue Moſes may
be Gods mouth; his law muſt them wholly ſway.

lg.label: chapter 6
lg.l: Fear and obey, of Gods law 'tis the end:
thy houſhold teach, God will his bleſſing ſend.

lg.label: chapter 7
lg.l: Gods people may not mix with Nations rude:
If they him ſerve, Chams ſeed ſhall be ſubdu'd.

lg.label: chapter 8
lg.l: Here's preſt obedience from Gods goodneſs, and
Canaans; their wealth flows not from their own hand.

lg.label: chapter 9
lg.l: In this their merits Moſes doth explode,
rehearſing ſeveral ſins againſt their God.

lg.label: chapter 10
lg.l: Keeping Gods laws with love and fear, is all
requir'd. Gods power and praiſe for this doth call.

lg.label: chapter 11
lg.l: Love, ſervice, taught from trials, and promiſes:
on Ebal they muſt curſe, on Ger'zim bleſs.

lg.label: chapter 12
lg.l: Marr Idols reliques, blood forbear, tythes pay,
where worſhipt's God, eat holy things they may.

lg.label: chapter 13
lg.l: Nor towns, nor perſons, that to Idols draw
may ſpared be, muſt periſh by Gods law

lg.label: chapter 14
lg.l: Of meats allow'd, and tythes, the kinds likewiſe:
in mourning they themſelves may not diſguiſe.

lg.label: chapter 15
lg.l: Poor, and ſervants releaſt when; gifts and loan
muſt not be ſtopt; the firſtlings are Gods own.

lg.label: chapter 16
lg.l: Quitted from off'ring none be at ſet feaſts:
Judgment corrupt, groves, Idols, God deteſts.

lg.label: chapter 17
lg.l: Render ſound off'rings: Idol-ſervers ſlay:
When Judge and Prieſt muſt Judge. How Kings muſt ſway.

lg.label: chapter 18
lg.l: See Prieſts and Levites portions; Witchcraft fly:
Chriſt muſt be heard; the falſe Prophet muſt die.

lg.label: chapter 19
lg.l: The uſe of refuge towns, change not land-bounds;
What witneſs good; falſe puniſhed when found.

lg.label: chapter 20
lg.l: View rules for war; who muſt fight, who forbear:
What towns and trees muſt ſaved be, ſee here.

lg.label: chapter 21
lg.l: A law for murder hid, captive wife, heir
who muſt be; what doom ſtubborn ſons muſt bear.

lg.label: chapter 22
lg.l: Beaſts found, for birds, houſes, and cloaths rules ſee:
mixtures, wife-ſlandering, luſts, adultery.

lg.label: chapter 23
lg.l: Church officers, Camp uncleanneſs, filthineſs,
loath'd off'rings, uſury, vows, treſpaſſes.

lg.label: chapter 24
lg.l: Divorce, new-married, pledges, leproſie;
man-theft, th' hirelings pay, right and charity.

lg.label: chapter 25
lg.l: Edicts for ſtripes, raiſing ſeed, unjuſt weight,
immodeſt wife: extirping Am'lek quite.

lg.label: chapter 26
lg.l: Firſt-fruits and tythes who offreth, what to ſay.
Gods covenant with Iſrael ſee you may.

lg.label: chapter 27
lg.l: Grav'd muſt the law on ſtone be. Of whole ſtone
the Altar: Mounts for bleſs, and curſe are ſhown.

lg.label: chapter 28
lg.l: Here bleſſings to obedience are pronounc'd:
curſes 'gainſt diſobedience are denounc'd.

lg.label: chapter 29
lg.l: In covenant all engage: preſumptions danger:
to touch with ſecret things provokes Gods anger.

lg.label: chapter 30
lg.l: Kindneſs to penitents: the law is neer;
life and death are propounded to them here.

lg.label: chapter 31
lg.l: Lectures to Joſhuah, Prieſts, and people all:
Law kept in th' Ark: Moſes ſpeaks Iſr'els fall.

lg.label: chapter 32
lg.l: Moſes ſong; they muſt weigh it heartily:
he muſt on Nebo Canaan ſee, and dy.

lg.label: chapter 33
lg.l: Note here Gods Majeſty. The Tribes are bleſt
by Moſes. Iſr'els glory is expreſt.

lg.label: chapter 34
lg.l: Of Moſes death, and burial, age, and praiſe;
Joſhua ſucceeds: Iſr'el mourns thirty days.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: APpointed Joſhuah's Moſes to ſucceed:
Gods aid aſſur'd: obedience all agreed.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: By Rahab Spies kept ſafe, her ſafety ſwear;
return'd, they ſhew their hopes, and Canaans fear.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Come all to Jordan, then th' Ark goes before:
Jordan parts; there th' Ark ſtays till all paſs o're,

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Dumb Monuments of this fact, by Gods command,
twelve ſtones in Jordan, twelve in Gilgal ſtand.

lg.label: chapter 5
lg.l: Encreaſt is Chams fear, Manna ceas'd, renew'd
the Sacrament; Joſh. doth an Angel view.

lg.label: chapter 6
lg.l: Fall Jericho's walls do, plundred; and ſet free
is Rahab; curſed its Rebuilders be.

lg.label: chapter 7
lg.l: God Iſr'el foils at Ai, for Achans theft;
the thief is found, his all, of life bereft.

lg.label: chapter 8
lg.l: How Ai's deſtroy'd, the Law in ſtone diſplaid,
and publiſht on thoſe mounts, as God had ſaid.

lg.label: chapter 9
lg.l: Iſr'el to root out Kings combine, as one;
by craft a league obtain doth Gibeon.

lg.label: chapter 10
lg.l: Kings five with Gibeon war, the Sun ſtands ſtill
at Joſhuahs pray'r, whilſt he his foes doth kill.

lg.label: chapter 11
lg.l: Lie ſlain at Merom divers Kings do, all
the land ſubdu'd; cut off the Anakims tall.

lg.label: chapter 12
lg.l: Mad Sihon, Og, with one and thirty more,
are mention'd partly here, partly before.

lg.label: chapter 13
lg.l: Not conquer'd lands are nam'd, Balaam is ſlain:
two Tribes and half part: what is Levies gain.

lg.label: chapter 14
lg.l: On this ſide Jordan nine Tribes and half have
their portions: Caleb doth Hebron crave.

lg.label: chapter 15
lg.l: Pronounc'd is Judah's lot: Achſahs demand;
the Jebuſites not yet expell'd the land.

lg.label: chapter 16
lg.l: Quarters of Joſeph, and Ephraim ſee,
the Canaanites as yet unconquered be.

lg.label: chapter 17
lg.l: Rehears'd's Manaſſes coaſt. Chams ſeed is not
expell'd. Joſephs Sons get another lot.

lg.label: chapter 18
lg.l: Shiloh the Tabernacle holds; the reſt
of Canaan's parted: Ben's lot is expreſt.

lg.label: chapter 19
lg.l: The ſix Tribes more have lots; the ſon of Nun
hath Timnah Serah for poſſeſſion.

lg.label: chapter 20
lg.l: Unwilling killers of men, without hate,
have refuge-Cities pointed in each State.

lg.label: chapter 21
lg.l: A portion God doth to the Levites give,
fourty eight Towns. Iſr'el in peace doth live.

lg.label: chapter 22
lg.l: Back the two Tribes are ſent, an Altar make:
the reſt are mov'd; cauſe known, they well it take.

lg.label: chapter 23
lg.l: Counſel grave Joſhuah gives before he dies,
by benefits paſt, Promiſes, menacies.

lg.label: chapter 24
lg.l: Draws all to Shechem, Gods cov'nant renews:
His age, death; Eleazers next enſues.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: ACts of eight Tribes; Adonibezek ſlain:
Othniel Debir takes, Achſah to gain.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: Bochim's the place the Angel chides, they cry;
their wickedneſs; Chams ſeed left them to try.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Canaanites them corrupt ſcourge in Gods anger:
they mourn, are freed by Othniel, Ehud, Shamgar.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Deb'rah and Barak Jabins Army quail;
Jael kills Siſera with a tent nail.

lg.label: chapter 5
lg.l: Extolling God in ſong, the Propheteſs
the backward blames, the forward Tribes doth bleſs.

lg.label: chapter 6
lg.l: Falling from God, Midian them 'preſs: they grieve,
God chides, yet Gideon ſends, them to relieve.

lg.label: chapter 7
lg.l: Gideon three hundred only takes by lot,
on Midians multitude a conqueſt got.

lg.label: chapter 8
lg.l: Here Zeba, and Zalmunna's hoſts are ſlain:
Gideon dies, the Jews worſhip Baal again.

lg.label: chapter 9
lg.l: Jotham Abimelech's tells, and Shechems fall
who King'd him; all's fulfill'd by means of Gaal.

lg.label: chapter 10
lg.l: Kept down by foes for falſe gods, Iſr'els ſent
to them for aid; he turns, God doth repent.

lg.label: chapter 11
lg.l: Lead them doth Jephthah, vows, doth overcome
Ammon; performs his vow when he comes home.

lg.label: chapter 12
lg.l: Malign him Ephraim doth; by Sibboleth
diſcover'd are, all ſlain; here's Jephthahs death,

lg.label: chapter 13
lg.l: New ſins enſlave Jews to Philiſtims ſcorn;
Manoahs ſacrifice, Sampſon is born.

lg.label: chapter 14
lg.l: Of Sampſons honey ſee, match, riddle, fate
of Askelon; his wife given to his mate.

lg.label: chapter 15
lg.l: Philiſtims corn he burns; they burn his wife.
An Aſſes jaw a thouſand rids of life.

lg.label: chapter 16
lg.l: Quean Dalilah him betrays, his eyes are loſt:
He vengeance taking, yieldeth up the ghoſt.

lg.label: chapter 17
lg.l: Riches by Micah ſtoln, he brings again;
Idols they make, a Prieſt they entertain.

lg.label: chapter 18
lg.l: Stript of their gods, and Prieſt, they are by Dan.
when careleſs Laiſh by the ſword, he wan.

lg.label: chapter 19
lg.l: The Levites wife abus'd at Gibeah, dead;
is cut in twelve, and over Iſrael ſpread.

lg.label: chapter 20
lg.l: Vile though, the fact Benjamites do defend;
foil Iſr'el twice; are ruin'd in the end.

lg.label: chapter 21
lg.l: A Tribes loſs moan'd; ſix hundred men remain;
who wives obtain, their Tribe to raiſe again.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: A Dearth Elimelech and his Sons death brings
in Moab: Ruth to home-bound Naomi clings.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: Boaz Ruth gleaning finds, and favour ſhows:
Ruth of her corn on Naomi beſtows.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Counſell'd by her, Ruth lies at Boaz feet:
a kinſmans part is promis'd, as was meet.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Diſcharge he doth his promiſe; Marriage joyns
with Ruth: a royal ſeed ſprings from their loyns.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: AT Hannahs prayer heal'd's her barrenneſs:
Samuels birth vow'd to God; rendred is.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: By ſong Hannah thanks God; more children hath:
Eli reproves his ſons; God threats in wrath.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Call'd Samuel is; God ſhews him Elies woes;
he ſhews it Eli; and in credit grows.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Defeated Iſrael is; the Ark is loſt;
with Elies ſons; his, Phineas wifes life, coſt.

lg.label: chapter 5
lg.l: Ekron, Gath, Aſhdod plagu'd with Emerod,
for their profaning of the Ark of God.

lg.label: chapter 6
lg.l: From Philiſtims the Ark's return'd again:
the Bethſhemites looking into it, are ſlain.

lg.label: chapter 7
lg.l: Gods Ark to Kiriath brought; they wail their ſins:
at Samuels pray'r, they rout the Philiſtims.

lg.label: chapter 8
lg.l: His ſons not treading Samuels path, they crave
a King; his manner ſhewn: their will they have.

lg.label: chapter 9
lg.l: In ſeeking his Sires Aſſes loſt, Saul goes
to Samuel, who him feaſts; his reign foreſhows.

lg.label: chapter 10
lg.l: King Saul's annointed, firm'd by ſigns, heart new'd
choſen by lot, deſpis'd by varlets rude.

lg.label: chapter 11
lg.l: Lockt up by ſiege of Nahaſh, Jabiſh men
Seek aid; Saul frees them, is made King ag'en.

lg.label: chapter 12
lg.l: Mention'd is Samuels Juſtice; Iſr'els ſin,
with thunder-fearing, mercy comforting.

lg.label: chapter 13
lg.l: Noid's Geba's fort allarm Philiſtims ſound;
Sauls off'ring checkt; with him no ſmith is found

lg.label: chapter 14
lg.l: O'rethrown the Philiſtims by Jonathan are:
Sauls oath; his ſons ſentence the people bar.

lg.label: chapter 15
lg.l: Preſerving Amaleks ſpoils God Saul forſakes:
Samuel kills Agag; and of Saul leave takes.

lg.label: chapter 16
lg.l: Quitting Saul, Samuel 'nointeth David Ki •…
Sauls evil ſpirit's expell'd by his harping.

lg.label: chapter 17
lg.l: Repell'd Sauls hoſt is, at Goliahs ſight;
David him kills; Philiſtims put to flight.

lg.label: chapter 18
lg.l: Strong love this drew from Jonathan, Sauls hate:
Saul, Michal as a ſnare, gives for his mate.

lg.label: chapter 19
lg.l: Trains 'gainſt David, by Jonathan ſhewn be;
pleads for him; Sauls rage: Michal ſets him free.

lg.label: chapter 20
lg.l: With David Jonathan doth league renew:
Sauls anger 'gainſt them both; their ſad adiew.

lg.label: chapter 21
lg.l: Abimelech at Nob doth entertain
David; at Gath fear makes him madneſs fain.

lg.label: chapter 22
lg.l: Bands flock to David, he his Parents leaves
in Moab: Doeg Prieſts of life bereaves.

lg.label: chapter 23
lg.l: Chace Keilahs foes doth David, falſe their heart;
Saul rounding him, Philiſtims Saul divert.

lg.label: chapter 24
lg.l: David ſpares Sauls life, ſhews his innocence;
Sauls ſwears him parts, confeſſing his offence.

lg.label: chapter 25
lg.l: Ended is Sam'els life; Abigails wiſe carriage
prevents from blood: Nabals death; & her marriage.

lg.label: chapter 26
lg.l: From ſlaying Saul David Abiſhai ſtays:
takes Sauls ſpear; Saul's and Abners fault diſplays.

lg.label: chapter 27
lg.l: Gath holding David, Saul purſues no moe:
David beggs Ziklag; 's counted Judahs foe.

lg.label: chapter 28
lg.l: He's Achiſh's guard: Saul left of God in fear,
ſeeks to a witch; from her his fall doth hear.

lg.label: chapter 29
lg.l: Incens'd Philiſt. David away do ſend:
him both doth Achiſh, and his acts commend.

lg.label: chapter 30
lg.l: Kindled at Ziklags ſpoil are Davids men:
he Amalek purſues, gains all age'n.

lg.label: chapter 31
lg.l: Loſing the battle, Saul and his ſons fall:
whom Jabiſh men honour with funeral.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: AN Amal'kite owning Sauls death, is ſlain:
David laments Saul, and his Jonathan.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: By Judah David's crown'd; crow'nd's Iſhboſheth
by Abner; their men fight: Aſ'hels death.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: 'Creaſt's Davids power, and ſons: chaf'd Abner turns;
Joab him kills, is curs'd; David him mourns.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Dire Traitors Iſhboſheth their Maſter ſlay:
to them the like King David doth repay.

lg.label: chapter 5
lg.l: Enſtall'd by all's David, takes Zions Tower:
Hiram ſends gifts; Philiſtims feel his power.

lg.label: chapter 6
lg.l: From Gibeah th'Ark's brought; Uzza's death: its reſt
with Obed, thence to Zion: Davids feaſt.

lg.label: chapter 7
lg.l: Gods houſe David would build, forbad; Gods bleſſing
on him, and his; he prays, and thanks confeſſing.

lg.label: chapter 8
lg.l: Here diverſe Kings ſubdu'd: Toi's preſents are
off'red to God, with Treaſures gain'd in War.

lg.label: chapter 9
lg.l: Jonathans Son Ziba to Court doth bring:
his honour; Sauls lands giv'n him by the King.

lg.label: chapter 10
lg.l: King Nahaſh dead, David to chear his Son
ſends Meſſengers; are abus'd: War thereon.

lg.label: chapter 11
lg.l: Long's Rabbah ſieg'd, Davids adultery:
Uriah murther'd is by treachery.

lg.label: chapter 12
lg.l: Made known his ſins by Nathan, he repented:
Solomons birth; Rabbah ſurpriz'd, tormented.

lg.label: chapter 13
lg.l: Noble-ſprung Tamar Amnon doth defile:
Abſolon flies, having him ſlain by guile.

lg.label: chapter 14
lg.l: Obtain doth Tekoas widow his return:
his beauty, ſeed; he Joabs corn doth burn.

lg.label: chapter 15
lg.l: Proud Abſalon rebels, his father flies:
Curſeth Achitophel: Davids Armies.

lg.label: chapter 16
lg.l: Quitted with treachery Ziba; Shimei rails:
Huſhai complies; the houſe-top inceſt wails.

lg.label: chapter 17
lg.l: Rude is Achitophels death: by Davids friends
what courſe to ſteer, what's counſel'd, Huſhai ſends.

lg.label: chapter 18
lg.l: Strict's David's charge concerning Abſolon;
he's hang'd in oak, his Fathers grief thereon.

lg.label: chapter 19
lg.l: This ceas'd by Joab, the King home is brought.
Excus'd Mephiboſheth: Shemei pardon ſought.

lg.label: chapter 20
lg.l: With Sheba's death at Abel the War ends:
falſe Joab Amaſa to his grave, ſends.

lg.label: chapter 21
lg.l: A three years famine for Sauls cruelties:
ſeven of his ſons hang'd: Davids victories.

lg.label: chapter 22
lg.l: By ſongs doth David his Gods praiſe advance,
for bleſſings, great power, full deliverance.

lg.label: chapter 23
lg.l: Confeſt beyond ſenſe Davids faith is here
in his laſt words: his mighty men who were.

lg.label: chapter 24
lg.l: David doth number Iſrael, wailes th' offence:
of three plagues chuſeth three days peſtilence.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: AGe muſt a nurſe have; Adonijah reigns:
Solomon's crown'd: th'Uſurper pardon gains.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: Bold Joab, Sh • mei, Adonijah, ſlain:
the cauſes, Zauok doth the Prieſt-hood gain.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Chuſing of wiſdom, Solomon gains life,
wealth and honour: he ends two harlots ſtrife.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Deſcrib'd are Solomons greatneſs, Princes, peace,
proviſion, ſtate, books, wiſdom, great encreaſe.

lg.label: chapter 5
lg.l: Exchang'd for goods, trees, men by Hiram be
for Temple work: the workmens number ſee.

lg.label: chapter 6
lg.l: Form of the Temple, when built how extended:
its beauty, Gods promiſe: In what time ended.

lg.label: chapter 7
lg.l: Great ſtructures rais'd, for Pharaohs Daughter one:
Hiram more Temple-work is ſet upon.

lg.label: chapter 8
lg.l: He dedicates Gods houſe; fill'd with Gods glory:
he bleſſeth, prays, offers, feaſts: read the ſtory.

lg.label: chapter 9
lg.l: Jahs promiſe; Solomon and Tyrus King
ſend preſents: his Fleet, and daily off'ring.

lg.label: chapter 10
lg.l: Knowing him, Sheba's Queen admires the King,
his glory, gold, Throne: all him preſents bring.

lg.label: chapter 11
lg.l: Led by his wives to Idols, God threatneth
his Kingdoms rent; his foes nam'd: & his death.

lg.label: chapter 12
lg.l: Mov'd by Re'boams rigour, ten tribes chuſe dry:
Jeroboam; he Calves as gods doth uſe.

lg.label: chapter 13
lg.l: Nerves of the Kings hand, ſtretcht 'gainſt Seer,
the Seer ſlain; confirm'd his Propheſie.

lg.label: chapter 14
lg.l: Of her Sons and houſe's fate hears the Kings wife:
Nadab ſucceeds: Rehoboams wicked life.

lg.label: chapter 15
lg.l: Pure Aſa Abijam ſucceeds: next good
Jehoſhaphat: Baaſha ſheds Nadabs blood.

lg.label: chapter 16
lg.l: Quench Elah Zimri doth: Omri doth quel
him; Ahabs reign: Jericho builds Hiel.

lg.label: chapter 17
lg.l: Ravens Elijah, in a famine, feed:
the widows oyl encreas'd, her ſon raiſed.

lg.label: chapter 18
lg.l: Sent's Eli' Ahab to reprove; then ſlain
the Baalites are: God gives plenty of rain.

lg.label: chapter 19
lg.l: Threats cauſe Elijahs flight, he's comforted:
Jehu, Eliſha, Hazael, annointed.

lg.label: chapter 20
lg.l: Unmanlike terms Benhadad ſeeks, twice beaten:
finds favour; this moves God Ahab to threaten.

lg.label: chapter 21
lg.l: Ahab deni'd a Vineyard, Naboth's ſlain:
the Tyrants threatned are with blood again.

lg.label: chapter 22
lg.l: By Prophets falſe ſeduc'd Ahab doth bleed
at Ramoth: J'oſaphats reign: their ſons ſucceed.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: AHazi ſick, ſends to Baalzebub: fire
Two Troops kill; one's ſav'd: dead is Jorams Sire.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: Broad Jordan parts; Elijah mounts the sky:
Eliſha water heals: mocking boys die.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Conjoyn'd are three, to vanquiſh Moabs King:
Eliſha water gets: Meſha's off'ring.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Deadly broth's heal'd; oyl 'creas'd, pays widows debt:
Shunamites love doth wondrous love beget.

lg.label: chapter 5
lg.l: Eliſha Naaman cures, gifts doth deny:
Gehazi gets them with a leproſie.

lg.label: chapter 6
lg.l: Float Iron doth; the Syrians counſel's known:
blinded their hoſte; Samaria hungry grown.

lg.label: chapter 7
lg.l: Great plenty promiſeth the man of God:
the unbelieving Prince to death is trod.

lg.label: chapter 8
lg.l: Here Shunamites land's reſtor'd; Hazael ſucceeds
Benhadad. Jorams wicked reign and deeds.

lg.label: chapter 9
lg.l: Jehoram dies by Jehu's hand and power
in Naboths field: Jezabel dogs devour.

lg.label: chapter 10
lg.l: Killed are Ahabs ſons, and Baalites:
for Jehus ſin, Hazael Iſrael ſmites.

lg.label: chapter 11
lg.l: Laid ſafe is young Joaſh; Athaliah ſways:
Jehoj'da crowns him, her with blood repays.

lg.label: chapter 12
lg.l: Much good doth Joaſh whilſt the Prieſt remains:
After backſlides, 's ſlain: Amaziah reigns.

lg.label: chapter 13
lg.l: Now Jehoaz, next Joaſh, Iſr'el ſways:
Eliſha dies; his bones a dead man raiſe.

lg.label: chapter 14
lg.l: Of Amaziahs life, conqueſt, foil; ſlain
by Traytors: o're Iſr'el Jeroboams reign.

lg.label: chapter 15
lg.l: Pure is Uzziah; leprous: Jotham good:
five Kings in Iſr'el reign, four die in blood.

lg.label: chapter 16
lg.l: Quit Ahaz doth Gods fear, his houſe abuſe:
the Brazen Altar turns to his own uſe.

lg.label: chapter 17
lg.l: Ruling Hoſhea, Iſr'el's captive led:
Samarias mixt Religion's puniſhed.

lg.label: chapter 18
lg.l: Sound Hezekiah, Aſhurs King invades:
'Salems revolt proud Rabſhakeh perſwades.

lg.label: chapter 19
lg.l: The good King mourns, conſults with God, doth pray:
an Angel Aſhurs Hoſt; his Sons him ſlay.

lg.label: chapter 20
lg.l: Warn'd of his death, Hezekiah by pray'r,
gets fifteen years: Manaſſeh is his heir.

lg.label: chapter 21
lg.l: Acts monſtrous of Manaſſeh, God's wrath fill
'gainſt Judah: vile Amon his ſervants kill.

lg.label: chapter 22
lg.l: By Joſiah repair'd's the Temple; found
's the Law: Salems ruine doth Huldah ſound.

lg.label: chapter 23
lg.l: Conven'd are Judahs Elders, the Law read;
Cov'nant renew'd: Idols aboliſhed.

lg.label: chapter 24
lg.l: Down Joj'kims ſins him bring; next year his ſon:
vanquiſht is Salem, led to Babylon.

lg.label: chapter 25
lg.l: Encompaſs, take Salem, doth Babels King:
blinds Zedekiah, lifts Jehojachim.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: ADams line to Noah; Japhets, Shems, Hams,
Keturahs, Iſhmaels ſeed, and Edoms.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: Born, ſons to Iſr'el, Judah, Jeſſe, ſee;
Hezron, Jerahmeel, Sheſham, Calebs three.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Counted is Davids line to Zedekiah:
with all the Succeſſors of Jechoniah.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Drawn Judahs, Aſhers line is: Jabez pray'r:
Simeons ſeed, ſeat, conqueſt of Gedor, Seir.

lg.label: chapter 5
lg.l: Entred's the line, conqueſt of Reuben, Gad,
with half Manaſſeh: for ſin captives made.

lg.label: chapter 6
lg.l: Found are the Prieſts and Levites cities race:
Aarons office, and line to Ahimaaz.

lg.label: chapter 7
lg.l: Growth of Ben: Iſſacher, Aſh', Naphtali,
Manaſſeh; by Gath Ephraims tragedy.

lg.label: chapter 8
lg.l: Here Benjamins ſons, and chief men are told;
the ſtock of Saul, and Jonathan enroll'd.

lg.label: chapter 9
lg.l: Iſr'els and Judahs Genealogies;
Prieſts, Levites, Nethenims, Sauls ſtock likewiſe.

lg.label: chapter 10
lg.l: Kill'd's Saul and 's ſon (joy doth the Philiſtine:)
Jabeſh men them inter; his ruine, ſin.

lg.label: chapter 11
lg.l: Lift up at Hebron Davids to the Crown:
(Zions Tower taken:) his men of renown.

lg.label: chapter 12
lg.l: Mention'd are who at Ziklag to him came:
multitudes more at Hebron, men of fame.

lg.label: chapter 13
lg.l: Now the Ark brought is from Jearim; God ſlays
Uzza: three moneths the Ark with Obed ſtays.

lg.label: chapter 14
lg.l: Of Hirams love, Davids felicities,
in Children, people, wives; two Victories.

lg.label: chapter 15
lg.l: Prepar'd's a place, fetcht is the Ark; the King
danceth, is ſcoff'd by Michal for the thing.

lg.label: chapter 16
lg.l: Quires to ſing praiſe; the Kings Pſalm, off'rings mark;
Feaſts, Officers for to attend the Ark.

lg.label: chapter 17
lg.l: Raiſe no houſe David may to God, but his
Son ſhall; ſeed bleſt; he thanks, praiſes God for this.

lg.label: chapter 18
lg.l: Subdu'd are divers Kings; he dedicate
to God the ſpoils doth: his chief men of State.

lg.label: chapter 19
lg.l: The Meſſengers abus'd to Hanun ſent:
David makes Ammon, Syria, it repent.

lg.label: chapter 20
lg.l: Vanquiſht, ſpoil'd, tortur'd, Rabbah is: and three
Philiſtine gyants in three fights ſlain be.

lg.label: chapter 21
lg.l: A plague for Davids numbring Iſr'el, ſlayes:
David repents, prays, offers; God it ſtays.

lg.label: chapter 22
lg.l: Before his death, for Gods houſe he fits all;
directs his Son; his Princes help doth call.

lg.label: chapter 23
lg.l: Crown Solomon doth aged David, King;
divides the Levites, for their miniſtring.

lg.label: chapter 24
lg.l: Drawn into twice twelve Orders; th' Aaronites
are divided, Merarites, Cohathites.

lg.label: chapter 25
lg.l: Enumerated are the ſingers, and
their twice twelve orders by Davids command.

lg.label: chapter 26
lg.l: Fix'd are the Porters parts, gates, what to do:
Who, Treaſurers, Judges, Officers, who.

lg.label: chapter 27
lg.l: Guard in their moneths twelve Captains do the King:
the Tribes twelve Peers; Joab lets Iſraels numbring.

lg.label: chapter 28
lg.l: His Peers conven'd; ſerve God (ſaid he) my Son;
his Houſe build, here's the ſorm, proviſion.

lg.label: chapter 29
lg.l: Intreaties cauſe all t'offer willingly:
he prays, all bleſs, Sol. reigns: David doth dy.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: APprov'd is Solomon at Gibeon,
for wiſdoms choice; wealth, honour gains thereon.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: Begun's the Temple; to Hiram the King
for men, and timber ſends, obtains each thing.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Come read the Temples place, time, building, meaſure;
Ornaments, Cherubs, Vail, Pillars, with pleaſure.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Done's the braſs Altar; molten Sea behold,
Courts, Lavers, Tables, Candleſticks of gold.

lg.label: chapter 5
lg.l: Ent'ring the Ark, the Oracle, aloud
the Trumpets ſound; the Houſe fill'd with a cloud.

lg.label: chapter 6
lg.l: Firſt Iſr'el, Solomon then, God doth bleſs;
by Prayer Gods houſe conſecrated is.

lg.label: chapter 7
lg.l: Gods fire conſumes the off'rings; all oblation
bring; anſwer'd is the pray'r of Conſecration.

lg.label: chapter 8
lg.l: His Buildings, Rulers; Gentiles Tribute pay:
his Ophir fleet; his off'rings every day.

lg.label: chapter 9
lg.l: Jedidiah Sheba's Queen admires, for ſtate,
wiſdom, wealth; his preſents, his reign, and fate.

lg.label: chapter 10
lg.l: King Rehoboam ſlights his old Councel;
ten Tribes him leave: with ſtones Adoram kill.

lg.label: chapter 11
lg.l: Levites, Prieſts, all, fearing God, to him ſpeed:
fight Iſr'el he may not; his wives, forts, ſeed.

lg.label: chapter 12
lg.l: Mark Rehoboams ſin; Shiſhak him whips:
Repents, his Judgment leſs'ned, death him nips.

lg.label: chapter 13
lg.l: Next reigns Abijah, wars with Iſr'els King;
In God truſts, overcomes; his wives, off-ſpring.

lg.label: chapter 14
lg.l: Of Aſa's zeal ſee here; his peace, forts, might
Calling on God, he Zerah puts to flight.

lg.label: chapter 15
lg.l: Promis'd's Gods aid to his; Aſa with God
Cov'nants; unqueens Ma'chah for Idol-gods.

lg.label: chapter 16
lg.l: Quell'd from building Ramah is Baaſha:
Hanan. ſhut up: Phyſitians ſeek doth Aſa.

lg.label: chapter 17
lg.l: Reigns, proſpers Jehoſhaphat; Prieſts are ſent
Judah to teach; his ſtrength, foes, gifts, preſent.

lg.label: chapter 18
lg.l: Striking alliance with Ahab, he goes
Againſt Ramoth; Ahab his life doth loſe.

lg.label: chapter 19
lg.l: Threatned for this he goeth through his Land:
to Levites, Prieſts, and Judges gives command.

lg.label: chapter 20
lg.l: Up 'gainſt him comes Lots ſeed, he faſts prays, foils;
gives thanks: his Ebion Gezer fleet God ſpoils.

lg.label: chapter 21
lg.l: After him Joram reigns, his Brethren ſlays:
of wives, ſons rob'd, he ſadly ends his days.

lg.label: chapter 22
lg.l: By Jehu ſlain is wicked Ahaziah:
Joaſh ſav'd from the hands of Athaliah.

lg.label: chapter 23
lg.l: Crown'd Joaſh is by Jehojada, ſlain
Athaliah; God's worſhip's up again.

lg.label: chapter 24
lg.l: During Jehojada's life he's good; then falls
to Idols; Zacharie's blood for his blood calls.

lg.label: chapter 25
lg.l: Each Traytor ſlain, Amaziahs hir'd hoſt
diſmiſs'd, ſpoil'd, Edom foil'd; his pride dear coſt.

lg.label: chapter 26
lg.l: Full proſp'rous is Uzziah, till pride makes
him a leper; then Jotham the Rule takes.

lg.label: chapter 27
lg.l: Good is his reign; Ammon doth Tribute pay
of force: after him Ahaz bears the ſway.

lg.label: chapter 28
lg.l: Horrid is Ahaz, Syrians, Iſrael,
his people captives lead; his ſins excel.

lg.label: chapter 29
lg.l: In a good way doth Hezekiah reign:
purg'd is Gods Houſe; his worſhip up again.

lg.label: chapter 30
lg.l: Kept is the Paſſeover for fourteen days;
Altars deſtroy'd, with joy they give God praiſe.

lg.label: chapter 31
lg.l: Levites and Prieſts their work aſſigned have;
at the Kings word the Tythes the people gave.

lg.label: chapter 32
lg.l: Mark the pride, fall, of Aſhurs King and Hoſt;
Hezeki's ſick, cur'd, proud, yields up the ghoſt.

lg.label: chapter 33
lg.l: Naught is Manaſſes, captiv'd, prays, reſtor'd.
Amon like him, by ſervants in blood goar'd.

lg.label: chapter 34
lg.l: Of Joſiahs reforming, Law found, read:
he mourns, cov'nants, Judahs fall propheſi'd.

lg.label: chapter 35
lg.l: Paſſeover's kept by him; th' Aegyptian King
him kills; his loſs Judah doth ſadly ſing.

lg.label: chapter 36
lg.l: Quick ruine doth Joſiahs ſons ſeed bring
to Gods houſe, till reſtor'd by Perſia's King.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: AT Cyrus leave, Jews to return prepare,
for Temple-work; reſtor'd its Veſſels are.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: Behold the number of each Tribe, that went:
their goods, and what to God they did preſent.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Continual off'rings are on Altar made:
with tears, and joys, Temples foundation's laid.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Decree of Artaxerxes hindereth
the work, by foes procurement, to his death.

lg.label: chapter 5
lg.l: Encourag'd by Gods Prophets, once again
they buil'd; Tatnai would let, but all in vain.

lg.label: chapter 6
lg.l: Finiſht it is by Darius's command:
the Paſſeover is kept in Jury-Land.

lg.label: chapter 7
lg.l: Going to Jury, Ezra from the King
favour obtaineth; thanks God for the thing.

lg.label: chapter 8
lg.l: His company; for min'ſters he demands:
a faſt's kept; Treaſure put into Prieſts hands.

lg.label: chapter 9
lg.l: Iſr'els affinity with ſtrangers he
confeſſeth, mourns, prays 'gainſt it earneſtly.

lg.label: chapter 10
lg.l: Known here their grief is for this ſin, and care
to put their wives away, and who they were.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: AT Hanania's ſad news, Nehemi faſts,
mourns, prays, becauſe of Jeruſalem waſtes.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: By Perſia's King his grief is ſpi'd: he's ſent
to build Jeruſalem; their foes diſcontent.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Counted here are the names of perſons all,
and order; who re-edifi'd the wall.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Deride do foes, he prays; the work goes on,
with workmen arm'd they watch; his direction.

lg.label: chapter 5
lg.l: Extortion ſtopt, they reſtitution make:
the Rulers pay, Nehemy will not take.

lg.label: chapter 6
lg.l: Fraud, rumors, Prophets of Sanballat fail:
the wall is built, the foes hearts thereat quail.

lg.label: chapter 7
lg.l: Good Hananiah hath the Cities charge;
of Jews return'd a Catalogue at large.

lg.label: chapter 8
lg.l: Here Ezra reads the Law, the people weep;
but are forbid: the feaſt of booths they keep.

lg.label: chapter 9
lg.l: Iſr'el doth faſt, repent, Levites confeſs
their ſins; Gods goodneſs, Cov'nant, a redreſs.

lg.label: chapter 10
lg.l: Kept are their names, the Covenant who ſeal'd:
the tenure of it is at full reveal'd.

lg.label: chapter 11
lg.l: Lots ſhew the tenth perſon who muſt abide
in Salem; there the Rulers muſt reſide.

lg.label: chapter 12
lg.l: Mention'd are Prieſts who with Zerubbabel came:
they dedicate the wall with thankful clame.

lg.label: chapter 13
lg.l: Now read's the Law; communion mixt redreſſed:
Temple and Sabbath ſins: ſtrange wives repreſſed.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: AT the Kings feaſt Queen Vaſthi will not come;
Divorc'd: a Law, men ſhall bear rule at home.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: 'Bove all Maids Eſther is Queen'd; here a Treaſon
diſcovered is by Mordecai in ſeaſon.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Crouch to proud Haman will not Mordecai.
Haman gets a Decree, all Jews to ſlay.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Doleful are Jews; Eſther mov'd to redreſs
their woes; a faſt commands, to beg ſucceſs.

lg.label: chapter 5
lg.l: Eſther finds grace, feaſts Haman with the King:
for Mordecai a gallows is building.

lg.label: chapter 6
lg.l: For ſervice done Mordecai rides in ſtate,
by Hamans counſel; his friends ſpeak his fate.

lg.label: chapter 7
lg.l: Gain audience Eſther doth, Haman accuſe;
on his gallows is hang'd the foe of th' Jews.

lg.label: chapter 8
lg.l: Hamans houſe given to Eſther: the Decree
revers'd; Mordecai's honour: the Jews glee.

lg.label: chapter 9
lg.l: Jews enemies, and Hamans ſons, are ſlain:
the two days feaſt of Purim they ordain.

lg.label: chapter 10
lg.l: King Ahaſuerus greatneſs here's ſet forth:
with Mordecai his Publike-ſeeking worth.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: A Good great man is Job; by Gods permiſſion
Sathan him ſtrips of all; his rare ſubmiſſion.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: Boyls grieve Jobs body; grief doth pain his ſoul:
his wife him tempts; three friends come to condole.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Curſed is Jobs birth-day, he longs to die;
complains of life, becauſe of miſery.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Declaim againſt poor Job doth Eliphaz;
Gods judgments not on juſt, but wicked paſs.

lg.label: chapter 5
lg.l: End all men do in ſorrow; Gods affliction
regard: the happy end of his correction.

lg.label: chapter 6
lg.l: Far beyond fault his rod is; Job contends,
craves death, it comfort brings: 'plains of his friends.

lg.label: chapter 7
lg.l: Gall'd with continual plagues, Job longs to die:
his reſtleſneſs and Gods vigilancie.

lg.label: chapter 8
lg.l: Hypocrites ſure fall, from 'fore Ages ey'd:
Gods juſt dealing with men to Job appli'd.

lg.label: chapter 9
lg.l: Job having blam'd his friends, deſires to know
his ſin, and cauſe why God afflicts him ſo.

lg.label: chapter 10
lg.l: Kept down by grief, lifes wearineſs Job ſho'ws.
begs before death, ſome ſlacking of his woes.

lg.label: chapter 11
lg.l: Laſht's Job for ſelf-juſt, Gods wiſdom none can
ſearch out: the bleſſing of the penitent man.

lg.label: chapter 12
lg.l: Mov'd by his friends taunts, Job doth juſtifie
himſelf; ſets forth Gods Omnipotencie.

lg.label: chapter 13
lg.l: No friend Job hath but's partial: he doth ſhow
his faith, his ſins, and Gods purpoſe would know.

lg.label: chapter 14
lg.l: Obſtruct grace doth Job, death's ſure, life is ſhort:
paſt, no return; the cauſe ſin, he waits for't.

lg.label: chapter 15
lg.l: Poor Job for ſelf-defending is reprov'd
as wicked; wicked mens unquiet's prov'd.

lg.label: chapter 16
lg.l: Quip Job doth his friends for their cruelty:
Shews his ſad cauſe, pleads his innocencie.

lg.label: chapter 17
lg.l: Runs Job to God; harſh acts aſtoniſh may,
not quell the juſt; his hope's in death, not day.

lg.label: chapter 18
lg.l: See Job impatient, preſumptuous, blam'd:
the miſeries of wicked men are nam'd.

lg.label: chapter 19
lg.l: The ſad complaint of Job, and various woes;
craves pity, faith in th' Reſurrection ſhows.

lg.label: chapter 20
lg.l: Vile mens triumphing, and their final ſtate:
oppreſſion ſweet, ſhall end in diſmal fate.

lg.label: chapter 21
lg.l: A wicked man may thrive, who God withſtood:
his ruine. In death equal bad, and good.

lg.label: chapter 22
lg.l: By mans works God's not gain'd: many ſins laid
'gainſt Job; call'd to repent with grace diſplai'd.

lg.label: chapter 23
lg.l: Confeſſing Gods grace, Job longs him to ſee:
God unſeen, ſee us, his ſtable decree.

lg.label: chapter 24
lg.l: Deceit, oppreſſion, and adultery,
though ſafe a while, are in Gods dreadful eye.

lg.label: chapter 25
lg.l: Elohims fear, dominion, and might,
declare can no man, nor be juſt in's ſight.

lg.label: chapter 26
lg.l: From Bildad Job no help nor comfort findes:
of Gods great Pow'r and Providence him mindes.

lg.label: chapter 27
lg.l: Good Job's ſincere; ſans hope the Hypocrite:
On ill mens bleſſings God doth curſes write.

lg.label: chapter 28
lg.l: Had may be knowledge of things natural;
not wiſdom, its worth; muſt from Heaven fall.

lg.label: chapter 29
lg.l: Job longeth for, declares his former ſtate;
his juſtice, when he judged in the gate.

lg.label: chapter 30
lg.l: Kickt at by varlets is in miſery:
he condol'd others, God hears not his cry.

lg.label: chapter 31
lg.l: Luſt, fraud, oppreſſion, av'rice, bribery,
Job doth diſclaim; his hoſpitality.

lg.label: chapter 32
lg.l: Mov'd young Elihu's with Job and his friends,
having them heard, in zeal his judgment ſpends.

lg.label: chapter 33
lg.l: Now (as God) pleads; he no count of his facts
gives: his ways to call men to holy acts.

lg.label: chapter 34
lg.l: Old Jobs charg'd, charging God with wrong; he muſt
be juſt: m • n lies before him in the duſt.

lg.label: chapter 35
lg.l: Paſt hurt by ſin is God, or by good, gain:
men wanting faith in trouble cry in vain.

lg.label: chapter 36
lg.l: Quench doth Jobs ſins Gods favour, whom he muſt
extol and magnifie; becauſe he's duſt.

lg.label: chapter 37
lg.l: Renown'd is Gods power by his works; this binds
man him to fear: his wiſdom none out finds.

lg.label: chapter 38
lg.l: Summon'd is Job by God to anſwer; he
's convinc'd of ignorance, debility.

lg.label: chapter 39
lg.l: The goats and other Creatures named are,
Gods Providence and power to declare.

lg.label: chapter 40
lg.l: Vile, Job himſelf affirms; God him ſtir doth
his attributes to ſhew: of Behemoth.

lg.label: chapter 41
lg.l: Almighty God ſets forth what he do can
by his diſpoſe: of great Leviathan.

lg.label: chapter 42
lg.l: Bows Job to God, his cauſe preferr'd; his friends
ſubmit; he's bleſt with wealth: his days he ends.

lg.label: Psalm 1
lg.l: A Good man's bleſt, deſcrib'd, as fruitful tree:
the wicked, as the chaff, deſtroy'd ſhall be.

lg.label: Psalm 2
lg.l: Bold Heathen rage, conſult 'gainſt Chriſt, in vain:
they muſt ſubmit themſelves unto his reign.

lg.label: Psalm 3
lg.l: Compell'd by Abſolon, David doth fly:
he prays, on God reſts for ſecurity.

lg.label: Psalm 4
lg.l: David begs audience, enemies doth reprove,
exhort: mans happineſs ſtands in Gods love.

lg.label: Psalm 5
lg.l: Expreſſing Gods hate 'gainſt vile men, he prays
for his foes fall; the Saints ſafety always.

lg.label: Psalm 6
lg.l: Filled with grief through ſickneſs, and fierce foes,
he mercy ſues: through faith triumphs o're thoſe.

lg.label: Psalm 7
lg.l: 'Gainſt his foes hate (profeſſing innocency)
he prays: their fall; his ſafety faith doth ſpy.

lg.label: Psalm 8
lg.l: Heav'ns hoſt, and all the world ſet forth Gods praiſe:
his love to man doth admiration raiſe.

lg.label: Psalm 9
lg.l: Jah's prais'd for foes defeat; David prays, he
like cauſe may have ill mens ruine to ſee.

lg.label: Psalm 10
lg.l: King David prays 'gainſt ill mens inſolence:
prays for redreſs, profeſſeth confidence.

lg.label: Psalm 11
lg.l: Let ſinners threat, David truſts God, who knows
their plots, their end; to good men his face ſhows.

lg.label: Psalm 12
lg.l: Marking good mens decay, help he doth pray:
proud fl • tt'ring tongues, oppreſſours God will ſlay.

lg.label: Psalm 13
lg.l: No help comes, David cries how long, he prays
preventing grace, reſts on Gods gracious rays.

lg.label: Psalm 14
lg.l: Th'Atheiſts, vile, are nat'ral men, yet fear:
David on Gods ſalvation truſt doth rear.

lg.label: Psalm 15
lg.l: Pourtrai'd are thoſe in Zion who ſhall dwell;
none taking uſe, bribes; none who tales, lies tell.

lg.label: Psalm 16
lg.l: Quickned by faith, not works, for help he prays:
hates idle hopes to riſe and live always.

lg.label: Psalm 17
lg.l: Reſting on his right heart, he aid doth call.
ſhews his foes pride, craft; in hope ſues their fall.

lg.label: Psalm 18
lg.l: Sav'd from his enemies, and Saul, he ſings
praiſe for Gods various wonderful bleſſings.

lg.label: Psalm 19
lg.l: The Creatures ſhew Gods praiſe, the word his grace:
he prays 'gainſt ſins cloſe reigning; for Gods face.

lg.label: Psalm 20
lg.l: Venting her prayſes forth, the King to bleſs:
the Church truſts, God will give her more ſucceſs.

lg.label: Psalm 21
lg.l: A Pſalm of praiſe for getting Ammons crown:
David truſts his foes ſhall ſink lower down.

lg.label: Psalm 22
lg.l: Being diſmai'd, David complains and prays:
in his diſtreſs, others to thanks doth raiſe.

lg.label: Psalm 23
lg.l: Confident of comfort in every ſtate,
Gods goodneſs will him follow unto fate.

lg.label: Psalm 24
lg.l: Due right to th' earth hath Chriſt, heav'ns dwellers ſee:
the King of glory muſt received be.

lg.label: Psalm 25
lg.l: Exalting faith, David doth beg of God;

for ſins remiſſion, and help from
•… s rod.

lg.label: Psalm 26
lg.l: Flying to God, David makes this his ground
('mongſt ſinners, not body) his heart is ſound.

lg.label: Psalm 27
lg.l: Gods pow'r, his love to God, his fervent pray'r
ſupports his faith againſt ſtorms of deſpair.

lg.label: Psalm 28
lg.l: He prays againſt his enemies; God doth bleſs
petitions for Gods peoples happineſs.

lg.label: Psalm 29
lg.l: Incited Kings are God to glorifie;
for his pow'r, his peoples ſecurity.

lg.label: Psalm 30
lg.l: Knit's Davids heart, for ſafety God to bleſs
for his ſtate; calls others the like t'expreſs.

lg.label: Psalm 31
lg.l: Leaning on God he begs help in diſtreſs:
joys in Gods mercy, praiſeth his goodneſs.

lg.label: Psalm 32
lg.l: Man's bleſt who's freed, of ſin guilt from the annoy;
Confeſſion brings eaſe, but Gods mercy joy.

lg.label: Psalm 33
lg.l: Note forth Gods praiſe, for his pow'r, Providence,
and goodneſs; caſt on him your confidence.

lg.label: Psalm 34
lg.l: O praiſe God, I will bleſs him, David ſaith;
the priviledge of fearing God, and faith.

lg.label: Psalm 35
lg.l: Praying againſt his foes, he doth complain
their wrongs, begs God vengeance on them to rain:

lg.label: Psalm 36
lg.l: Queſtion God lewd ones do; their naughty ways:
Gods grace to his is great; for this he prays.

lg.label: Psalm 37
lg.l: Righteous men muſt wait, not at ill men fret:
their Sun, in joys; ill mens in woes ſhall ſet.

lg.label: Psalm 38
lg.l: Smit with Gods arrows, falſe friends become foes;
he praiſes God, will haſten thereof a cloſe.

lg.label: Psalm 39
lg.l: The care of's words he ſhews; lifes brevity:
deliv'rance ſues, from ſin and miſery.

lg.label: Psalm 40
lg.l: Urg'd is faiths good, obedience doth excel
Off'rings; he prays God, thankleſs foes to quel.

lg.label: Psalm 41
lg.l: Almeſgivers bleſt; Davids foes treacherous are;
he flees to God, experienc'd of his care.

lg.label: Psalm 42
lg.l: Breathing his zeal to ſerve God in his houſe;
David his down-caſt Soul with faith doth rouze.

lg.label: Psalm 43
lg.l: Calling for aid, he prays again to ſee
Gods houſe; reſolves there to worſhip with glee:

lg.label: Psalm 44
lg.l: Declaring old favours the Church doth 'plain
her preſent ſtate; deſires Gods help again.

lg.label: Psalm 45
lg.l: Excellent is Chriſts Kingdom, glory, grace;
their duty, priviledge, whom he doth embrace.

lg.label: Psalm 46
lg.l: Firm in God is the Churches confidence:
he calls to eye Gods work in her defence.

lg.label: Psalm 47
lg.l: Gentiles are woo'd with joy to entertain
Chriſts Kingdom; he in all the earth ſhall reign.

lg.label: Psalm 48
lg.l: Here's Zions glory, and preheminence,
let her rejoyce, God is her guide, defence.

lg.label: Psalm 49
lg.l: In wealth's no truſt, it cannot God withſtand,
nor raiſe the dead; 'tis the work of Gods hand.

lg.label: Psalm 50
lg.l: Know here Gods glory in his Church; not rites
legal, but true obedience him delights.

lg.label: Psalm 51
lg.l: Lord my ſin-guilt and filth waſh thou away:
cleanſe my heart, bleſs the Church, David doth pray.

lg.label: Psalm 52
lg.l: Mad Doegs ſpite condemning, his fall he
foretells; the Saints joy, praiſe God it to ſee.

lg.label: Psalm 53
lg.l: No God there is, ſay Atheiſts; yet they fear:
Jacob in Gods ſafety himſelf doth chear.

lg.label: Psalm 54
lg.l: Of Ziphites David 'plaining help doth crave;
believing it, reſolves God thanks ſhall have.

lg.label: Psalm 55
lg.l: 'Plaining his ſad caſe, his foes falſneſs, ſins
prays againſt; Gods face to him comfort wins.

lg.label: Psalm 56
lg.l: Quarrelling foes, David truſts in Gods word;
promiſeth praiſe, when freed from enemies ſword.

lg.label: Psalm 57
lg.l: Running to God, David his dang'rous caſe
ſets forth; reſolves to praiſe him for his grace.

lg.label: Psalm 58
lg.l: School'd wicked Judges, men, are, he doth crave,
Gods wrath on them, thereat the Saints joy have.

lg.label: Psalm 59
lg.l: The Pſalmiſt ſhews, his foes are ſubtile, fell;
prays 'gainſt them, truſts in God: Gods praiſe will tell.

lg.label: Psalm 60
lg.l: Wailing their troubles, he doth pray God, ſave:
truſting Gods promiſe, he doth thence help crave.

lg.label: Psalm 61
lg.l: Arm'd with experience he to God doth fly:
Vows to ſerve God, for's promiſe, conſtantly.

lg.label: Psalm 62
lg.l: Breathing forth faith, David diſmays his foes:
invites Saints to make God their ſole repoſe.

lg.label: Psalm 63
lg.l: Chapped for God, David will bleſs Gods name:
ſure of his help, his foes ſhall fall with ſhame.

lg.label: Psalm 64
lg.l: Defence 'gainſt foes ſharp tongues, and plots profound,
he prays; aſſur'd God will them deadly wound.

lg.label: Psalm 65
lg.l: Extoll'd God's for his grace; th'elect are bleſt:
by him the earth refreſht is, with corn dreſt.

lg.label: Psalm 66
lg.l: For Gods pow'r, goodneſs, David calls; him praiſe:
his goodneſs to him he with thanks doth raiſe.

lg.label: Psalm 67
lg.l: God's ſu'd t'enlarge his reign, that the people
may joy, and the earth with encreaſe excel.

lg.label: Psalm 68
lg.l: Here, at the Arks removal is a Pray'r:
praiſe God for's mercy, works, and Churches care.

lg.label: Psalm 69
lg.l: In deep diſtreſs, David doth imprecate
his foes deſtruction; praiſeth God thereat.

lg.label: Psalm 70
lg.l: Kindled with zeal, he begs the ſpeedy fall
of ill men; good mens preſervation all.

lg.label: Psalm 71
lg.l: Leanning on God, he prays in his old days
not to be left; promiſing thanks always.

lg.label: Psalm 72
lg.l: Made is requeſt for Chriſts Type, Solomon,
their Kingdoms goodneſs, glory, here is ſhown.

lg.label: Psalm 73
lg.l: Noting ill mens wealth, he counts goodneſs vain:
in Gods houſe ſees their fall: truſts God again.

lg.label: Psalm 74
lg.l: O're Zions waſtes, wailing, for help he cries;
minding Gods pow'r, cov'nant, vile enemies.

lg.label: Psalm 75
lg.l: Praiſing God, upright judgment here is vow'd:
rebuked by Gods Providence are the proud.

lg.label: Psalm 76
lg.l: Quaintly ſet forth's Gods Power, Majeſty
in's Church; calling to ſerve him reverently.

lg.label: Psalm 77
lg.l: Rough is the Pſalmiſts fight with diffidence;
eying Gods works, he gathers confidence.

lg.label: Psalm 78
lg.l: Speak, learn Gods Law; Iſr'el for its neglects
caſt off: Judah, Zion, David, God elects.

lg.label: Psalm 79
lg.l: The fall of Jeruſalem he complains;
craves Gods relief, promiſing thankful ſtrains.

lg.label: Psalm 80
lg.l: Vented in plaints is the Church-miſery;
Gods grace turn'd frowns: he begs del • very.

lg.label: Psalm 81
lg.l: Act thanks to God for favours manifold:
the Jews rebellion from them good things hold.

lg.label: Psalm 82
lg.l: Blam'd are vile Judges, charged to do right:
the great Judge ſees them, will judg men of might.

lg.label: Psalm 83
lg.l: Conſpiring foes complain'd on are to God;
he prays 'gainſt thoſe who are the Churches rod.

lg.label: Psalm 84
lg.l: David longs to enjoy the Houſe of God:
bleſt they who in it have conſtant abode.

lg.label: Psalm 85
lg.l: Expert of favours old, he prays they may
hold on: waits for them, Gods grace is his ſtay.

lg.label: Psalm 86
lg.l: Firm'd by his zealous care, Gods pow'r & grace,
he 'plains the proud, implores Gods gracious face.

lg.label: Psalm 87
lg.l: Gods Churches glory, nature, is ſet forth;
her Members conſolation, encreaſe, worth.

lg.label: Psalm 88
lg.l: Heavily preſt with inward terrours, pains,
as at graves brim, David to God complains.

lg.label: Psalm 89
lg.l: Jah prais'd is for his cov'nant, power, Church-care:
Davids reign; he ſpeaks 'gainſt events contrare.

lg.label: Psalm 90
lg.l: Know here, life's frail and ſhort; ſin troubles brings:
Mercy is begg'd, releaſe of their ſuff'rings.

lg.label: Psalm 91
lg.l: Laid down's the ſafety, habitation
of ſuch as God hath ſet his love upon.

lg.label: Psalm 92
lg.l: Made are Gods works and judgments grounds of praiſe:
th'upright ſhall flouriſh, bear fruit in old days.

lg.label: Psalm 93
lg.l: Note here of Chriſts Kingdom the holineſs,
Majeſty, power, everlaſtingneſs.

lg.label: Psalm 94
lg.l: Oppreſſours complain'd are, the Lord knows all:
bleſs'd are Gods chaſten'd ones; he's their braſs wall.

lg.label: Psalm 95
lg.l: Praiſe the great God, fall down before him, kneel;
hard'n not your hearts, leſt of his wrath you feel.

lg.label: Psalm 96
lg.l: Quickned our thanks are from Gods Majeſty;
his reign, and judging all with equity.

lg.label: Psalm 97
lg.l: Rejoyce O earth, God reigns, confounded be
Idolaters: the Saints joy, light ſhall ſee.

lg.label: Psalm 98
lg.l: Sing praiſe to God, Jews, Gentiles, Creatures all:
his ſalvation all know, in general.

lg.label: Psalm 99
lg.l: The Lord in Zion's great, praiſe ye his Name;
worſhip him there, Prieſts, Prophets do the ſame.

lg.label: Psalm 100
lg.l: Unto the Lord make joyful noiſe all lands:
praiſe him in 's Houſe, we are made by his hands.

lg.label: Psalm 101
lg.l: A ſtate, houſe, David hath well diſciplin'd
'gainſt vice; for thoſe who are to good inclin'd.

lg.label: Psalm 102
lg.l: Beſet with grief he prays Sions redreſs:
takes comfort from Gods grace, unchangedneſs.

lg.label: Psalm 103
lg.l: Call'd from his Soul are thanks for pard'ning graces;
man's frail, Gods grace laſts; praiſe him in all places.

lg.label: Psalm 104
lg.l: Divine works, Providence, make David bleſs
God: conſtant praiſes he vows to expreſs.

lg.label: Psalm 105
lg.l: Expreſt's Gods care for Abr'am, and his ſeed;
to ſtir us up in praiſes to exceed.

lg.label: Psalm 106
lg.l: Frequent were Iſr'els ſins, but God forgave;
their wants ſupplied, praiſes let him have.

lg.label: Psalm 107
lg.l: Gods Prov'dence trav'llers, captives, ſick men ſee,
and Mariners: a deſart fat makes he.

lg.label: Psalm 108
lg.l: He praiſeth God, againſt his foes craves aid;
believes 'twill come, becauſe God hath it ſaid.

lg.label: Psalm 109
lg.l: Judas-like foes he plains, their ſins diſplaies:
his woful ſtate; prays help: promiſeth praiſe.

lg.label: Psalm 110
lg.l: Kingdom, Prieſthood, conqueſt, and ſuffering
of Jeſus Chriſt, the Pſalmiſt here doth ſing.

lg.label: Psalm 111
lg.l: Laud God, his works are glorious, gracious, right;
his word ſure: he redeems his with his might.

lg.label: Psalm 112
lg.l: Men good in this, and next world, bleſt ſhall be;
are lib'ral, wicked ones grieve it to ſee.

lg.label: Psalm 113
lg.l: Nations all (god's above) him glorifie.
he doth the poor raiſe, barren fructifie.

lg.label: Psalm 114
lg.l: Of Creatures dumb learn ye to fear the Lord:
he parts the Red Sea, Jordan with his word.

lg.label: Psalm 115
lg.l: Put truſt in God, he's glorious, Idols vain;
he mindeth, bleſſeth his; bleſs him again.

lg.label: Psalm 116
lg.l: Quit from diſtreſs by God, he duty, love
profeſſeth; ſtudieth how thankful to prove.

lg.label: Psalm 117
lg.l: Render praiſe to the Lord ye people all;
his mercy's great to us, his truth laſt ſhall.

lg.label: Psalm 118
lg.l: Sing praiſe to God, to truſt him it is beſt:
Chriſt coming in his Kingdom is expreſt.

lg.label: Psalm 119
lg.l: Theorems, praiſers, praiſes here behold;
godly profeſſions, Gods precepts extold.

lg.label: Psalm 120
lg.l: Vile Doegs tongue David prays 'gainſt, checks, moans;
that he doth ſojourn among wicked ones.

lg.label: Psalm 121
lg.l: A godly man great ſafety doth enjoy:
truſters in God are kept free from annoy.

lg.label: Psalm 122
lg.l: Beſet with joy he's for Jeruſalem;
thoſe who love, pray for her; he bleſſeth them.

lg.label: Psalm 123
lg.l: Call do the Saints on God, their truſt, aloud,
being fill'd with the ſcornings of the proud.

lg.label: Psalm 124
lg.l: Due praiſes gives the Church to God moſt high,
for her miraculous delivery.

lg.label: Psalm 125
lg.l: Each faithful man as Zion firm ſhall ſtand;
peace to the good; wo to the wicked brand.

lg.label: Psalm 126
lg.l: For her return from bondage the Church praiſe
doth give, prays, propheſies ſuccesful days.

lg.label: Psalm 127
lg.l: Gods bleſſing's all; without it all is vain:
'tis Gods bleſſing good Children to obtain.

lg.label: Psalm 128
lg.l: Happy is he who walketh in Gods ways,
in his works, wife, children, and length of days.

lg.label: Psalm 129
lg.l: Iſr'els ſafety in many troubles ſee;
Sions foes like the graſs on houſe-top be.

lg.label: Psalm 130
lg.l: Knit is his hope to prayer, patience
in hope: let Iſr'el hope in their defence.

lg.label: Psalm 131
lg.l: Lord, my heart is not proud, ſaith good King David;
let Iſrael hope in God to be ſaved.

lg.label: Psalm 132
lg.l: Minding his care of th' Ark, at its remove
he prays: to him and Sion God ſhews love.

lg.label: Psalm 133
lg.l: Note what a pleaſant thing it is to ſee
Brethren to dwell in perfect unity.

lg.label: Psalm 134
lg.l: O Servants of the Lord, who ſtand by night
in his houſe, bleſs ye all the Lord of might.

lg.label: Psalm 135
lg.l: Praiſe him for his grace, pow'r, ſuppreſſing foes;
Idols are vain: no praiſes let God loſe,

lg.label: Psalm 136
lg.l: Quoted are of Gods great works many a ſtory;
that of our thanks he may have the due glory.

lg.label: Psalm 137
lg.l: Remembring Zion, captive Jews do weep:
Babylon ſhall partake of curſes deep.

lg.label: Psalm 138
lg.l: Sing praiſes David doth, and propheſies
that Kings ſhall bleſs God: he on God relies.

lg.label: Psalm 139
lg.l: Th'all-ſeeing Providence he magnifies;
