admires his own form; wicked men defies.

lg.label: Psalm 140
lg.l: Vext David is with Saul and Doegs rod.
he prays againſt them, comfort finds in God.

lg.label: Psalm 141
lg.l: Acceptable he prays his ſuit may be;
his conſcience 'right, his life from dangers free.

lg.label: Psalm 142
lg.l: Batt'rd with trouble, Davids comfort lies
in pouring out to God his fervent cries.

lg.label: Psalm 143
lg.l: Complaining of his foes, their overthrow
he prays, for grace, Gods will to do and know.

lg.label: Psalm 144
lg.l: David thanks God for mercies: deprecates
his foes: his Kingdoms peace, wealth, ſupplicates.

lg.label: Psalm 145
lg.l: Extoll'd's God for his goodneſs, Kingdom, fame,
his Providence, ſaving mercy, praiſe his Name.

lg.label: Psalm 146
lg.l: Firſt to praiſe God, he warns 'gainſt Creature-truſt;
truſt God for's Prov'dence, Attributes, we muſt.

lg.label: Psalm 147
lg.l: God's to be prais'd for his care, mercy, pow'r.
Providence, outward bleſſings, word, each hour.

lg.label: Psalm 148
lg.l: He calls for praiſes from the Creatures all,
celeſtial, earthly, and the rational.

lg.label: Psalm 149
lg.l: Jehovah praiſe, to the Church for his love.,
and pow'r, his foes with vengeance to remove.

lg.label: Psalm 150
lg.l: Keys of the higheſt ſtrain, on muſick all,
muſt ſound Gods praiſe; his great acts for it call.

div.head: The Contents of the parts of the hundred and nineteenth PSALM.

lg.label: part 1 (A)
lg.l: A Bleſſing on, motives t'obedience;
his prayer for direction, purpoſe thence.

lg.label: part 2 (B)
lg.l: By Gods Law youth muſt live, ſeek joy thereat;
deſire, keep, love, talk of, and meditate.

lg.label: part 3 (C)
lg.l: Cry David doth for grace, knowledg, and ſongs
for Gods word; 'tis his refuge 'gainſt falſe tongues.

lg.label: part 4 (D)
lg.l: David by Gods word quickned, taught would be▪
and ſtrengthened; his reaſons, purpoſe ſee.

lg.label: part 5 (E)
lg.l: Earneſt he is to know and keep Gods way:
and not through av'rice, vanity, to ſtray.

lg.label: part 6 (F)
lg.l: For promis'd mercies he prays; why? he'l keep,
always ſpeak, think of, love Gods counſels deep.

lg.label: part 7 (G)
lg.l: Gods promiſe, word, & judgments comfort bring,
when deep calamities his Children wring.

lg.label: part 8 (H)
lg.l: His prayer, penitence, zeal, conſtancie,
companions ſhew, God his portion to be.

lg.label: part 9 (I)
lg.l: In trouble David gains; more knowledg prays;
proud hearts are fat: he is to keep Gods ways.

lg.label: part 10 (K)
lg.l: Kindneſs divine, knowledg, a heart ſincere
he ſues for, upon grounds expreſſed here.

lg.label: part 11 (L)
lg.l: Long troubles force complaints, faith doth not fail;
he'l keep Gods Law: prays mercy may him bail.

lg.label: part 12 (M)
lg.l: Make Gods word void nought can, 'tis Davids ſtay
in ſinking times; he'l it retain alway.

lg.label: part 13 (N)
lg.l: Nought he loves or minds more than Gods word, why?
than teachers, aged, he knows more thereby.

lg.label: part 14 (O)
lg.l: Obey he will, Gods word's his lamp, joy, lot:
begs acceptance, troubles him bend cannot.

lg.label: part 15 (P)
lg.l: Profeſſing love, obedience to Gods word,
he ſeeks ſupport: the wicked down are trod.

lg.label: part 16 (Q)
lg.l: Quoting Gods promiſe, he deliv'rance prays
from oppreſſors; Gods time is come he ſays.

lg.label: part 17 (R)
lg.l: Rare's Gods Law in effects, he longs for't: grace,
direction, begs; grievs 'cauſe it takes no place.

lg.label: part 18 (S)
lg.l: Straight, faithful, pure's Gods word: his foes him vext
for breaking it: he keeps it though perplext.

lg.label: part 19 (T)
lg.l: The Pſalmiſt craves relief; Gods ſtatutes he
will keep, early muſe on; true, firm they be.

lg.label: part 20 (U)
lg.l: Urging his conſtancie, zeal, love, Gods truth,
word, mercy; his ſuit for releaſe renew'th.

lg.label: part 21 (W)
lg.l: When Princes vex, Gods Law's his fear, hope, love,
he keeps it; ſuch great peace have from above.

lg.label: part 22 (Y)
lg.l: Yearning for audience, help, he vows to praiſe
God, preach his word; 'tis his choice, joy always.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: ATtend to wiſdoms Laws; lewd lures avoid:
ſcorners of wiſdoms counſel ſhalbe ſtroi'd.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: By wiſdom are her ſons taught how to ſhun
ill men, and whores, and in good ways to run.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Commandment keep, truth, mercy, patience,
faith, peace, alms-deeds, fear; wiſdoms excellence.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Directing Children to obey, he taught
his Fathers Laws. The paths of perſons naught
Decline: Get wiſdom, why? ſhun froward talk:
thy heart keep ſafe; thy paths weigh ere thou walk.

lg.label: chapter 5
lg.l: Eſteem wiſdom, content be, liberal,
chaſte; whoredoms miſchief, wicked men ſhall fall.

lg.label: chapter 6
lg.l: Flee ſuretiſhip, ſloth, miſchief. God doth hate
ſeven things: Obedience good: whoremongers ſtate.

lg.label: chapter 7
lg.l: Great is his danger, and ſimplicity,
who's led away by harlots flattery.

lg.label: chapter 8
lg.l: Here's wiſdoms fame, plainneſs, excellencie;
its nature, power, wealth, eternity.

lg.label: chapter 9
lg.l: Invited all are unto wiſdoms feaſt:
Scorners rebuke not: the whores ways expreſt.

lg.label: chapter 10
lg.l: Know how differ love, hate, wiſdom and folly:
ſloth, labour; juſt unjuſt, ſpeech bad and holy.

lg.label: chapter 11
lg.l: Lo, falſe weights, lowly, juſt, ſincere men, and
merciful 'gainſt their contraries here ſtand:
Light 'vails wealth, counſel much; good wives prais'd are:
Fair fools, taling, corn-hoorders, ſureties fare.

lg.label: chapter 12
lg.l: Merciful good men are; reproof fools hate;
his wrath ſoon known: a good wife crowns her mate.
Men good, wiſe, diligent, oppoſed ſee
to men contrary: Lyars hated be.

lg.label: chapter 13
lg.l: Nipt pratlers are, ſloth, pride, lyes, word-deſpiſer;
wiſe, good, deſcrib'd; good company makes wiſer.
Nought ſome have, yet rich: of wealth well, ill got:
of cock'ring parents; wicked nuncio's lot.

lg.label: chapter 14
lg.l: Of wiſdom, folly, ſigns; falſe witneſſings,
backbitings, labour: what advanceth Kings:
Oppreſſing, poor deſpiſing, fearing of God:
what good men do, and gain: wicked mens rod.

lg.label: chapter 15
lg.l: Pure tongue rules; God ſees all; wiſe, fools, good, bad:
mirth, ſorrow differenc'd; ſcorners caſe is ſad.
Pride, ſloth, brib'ry, their ill; with love and grace
a little, before troubled wealth, hath place.

lg.label: chapter 16
lg.l: Qualities royal; whiſp'rers, ſelf-conceit,
pride, frowardneſs; the good man's little's great.
Quiet grace gains; the wiſe, upright, meek prais'd;
all's made for God: by grace gray-hairs are rais'd.

lg.label: chapter 17
lg.l: Rule ſhall wiſe ſervants; God tries hearts, a friend
loves ſtill; faults blab not; fools ſigns; proud mans end.
Reproofs wiſe men embrace; the poor mock not:
by quiet, ſtrife, mirth, ſilence, what is got.

lg.label: chapter 18
lg.l: Strifes cauſe, ſloth; eye not men, pride: God's a tower:
a wounded ſp'rit; friends what? Death in tongues power.

lg.label: chapter 19
lg.l: The rich make friends: the poor his Brethren hate:
falſe ſwearers rod; the wrathful and fools fate.
The ſluggard, ſcold, merciful, wife that's wiſe;
ſmite ſcorners, waſte not parents; ſons chaſtiſe.

lg.label: chapter 20
lg.l: Wine mocks, a Kings wrath what; his duty: deep
is counſel: ſhun ſtrife, none clean; love not ſleep.
Works ſhew men; weights and buyers falſe; ſloth's vain:
Sire-curſers; taling; ſuretiſhip, ill gain.

lg.label: chapter 21
lg.l: Accepted's Juſtice, juſts joy; God weighs hearts:
ill gain, injuſtice, wickedneſs, ſubverts.
A ſcold, what? poor not hearing, loving pleaſure:
the good of labour: keeping tongue in meaſure.

lg.label: chapter 22
lg.l: Bounty, credit, wiſdom, humility;
their good: of training youth; heart purifie.
Bane of the froward, ſluggards, whores, ſureties.
oppreſſors: Landmarks move not; hear the wiſe.

lg.label: chapter 23
lg.l: Curbs for feeding; wealth ſtays not; th'Orphans field
take not; inſtructions hear: correct thy child.
Children good Parents joy, buy truth, decline
wine-bibbers, whores; the bane of drinking wine,

lg.label: chapter 24
lg.l: Draw from ill men; wiſdoms praiſe: Innocents
in danger help: ſpoil not the righteous tents.
Damp joys when foes fall; fear God and the King:
envy, revenge, falſe witneſs, ſloth, their ſting.

lg.label: chapter 25
lg.l: Edicts for Kings; ſtrife-rules; a word in ſeaſon
how good; vain boaſters: pleaſures uſe in reaſon.
Eſchew gadding; of falſe ſwearing the ill;
faithleſs men, brawling wives, enemies fill.

lg.label: chapter 26
lg.l: Fools, ſluggards, buſie-bodies are offence:
tale-bearers, flatt'rers cheat on loves pretence.

lg.label: chapter 27
lg.l: Great's envies rage; boaſt not; wiſe men foreſee
evil: of friends, ſcolds, care of family.

lg.label: chapter 28
lg.l: Heap many Lords doth ſin; ill ones enſlave:
givers no want; uſurers free ſons have.
How poor men paſs the rich; ill mates bring ſhame
and rags: he's bleſt that fears; quick getters blame.

lg.label: chapter 29
lg.l: In publick, private Government, inſtructions:
of anger, pride, theft, fearfulneſs, corruptions.

lg.label: chapter 30
lg.l: Know Gods word, add not to' t; a man ſtate's beſt:
Sire-mockers bane. Agurs fives, fours, expreſt.

lg.label: chapter 31
lg.l: Lemuel chaſte muſt be, ſober; muſt defend
and cheer the fainting. The good wifes commend.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: ALl things are vain, Creatures reſtleſs, nought new;
old forgot, Solomon found by wiſdoms view.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: Brave pleaſure's in vain; fools, wiſe, have one event:
none knows his heir; 'tis beſt joy in goods lent.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Changes of times; mans work's vain, Gods are beſt.
he ſhall judge man, who dies like the brute beaſt.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Dead prais'd are, from oppreſſions, coveting,
envy, ſloth; wiſe poor exceeds wilful King.

lg.label: chapter 5
lg.l: Entring Gods worſhip, beware; wealth is vain;
'tis Gods gift to enjoy our labours gain.

lg.label: chapter 6
lg.l: Full vain's wealth without uſe; without wealth vain
children, old age; none future things can name.

lg.label: chapter 7
lg.l: 'Gainſt vanity, a good name, patience,
the houſe of Mourning: Wiſdom's a defence.

lg.label: chapter 8
lg.l: Honour Kings, Divine Providence attend:
juſt poor, than wicked rich, make better end.

lg.label: chapter 9
lg.l: In outwards all's alike; none knows lifes length:
comfort's all this lifes lot: Wiſdom's 'fore ſtrength.

lg.label: chapter 10
lg.l: Kings when a curſe and bliſs; the difference
of folly and wiſdom. Of ſlothfulneſs.

lg.label: chapter 11
lg.l: Leſſons of charity: in life the day
of death and judgment youth muſt mind alway.

lg.label: chapter 12
lg.l: Minde thy Maker in youth: to edifie
's the Preachers care: Gods fear cures vanity.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: AFfecting Chriſt, his Spouſe, his flock would meet;
his love to her, each to other is ſweet.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: Behold the love of Chriſt and's Church: her hope;
his care of her, and her profeſſions ſcope.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Chriſt is withdrawn, the Church him ſeeks, and found;
ſhews his ſweetneſs and glory doth abound.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Declare doth Chriſt the Churches grace▪ his love;
ſhe prays fit for his preſence ſhe may prove.

lg.label: chapter 5
lg.l: Enter Chriſt would, ſhe's loath to riſe; away
he goes: ſhe love-ſick, his parts doth diſplay.

lg.label: chapter 6
lg.l: Faith in Chriſt the C • uch ſhews, he doth approve
her graces, and reveal to her his love.

lg.label: chapter 7
lg.l: Graces of the Church farther are expreſt:
the faith and deſire of the Church profeſt.

lg.label: chapter 8
lg.l: How much the Church loves Chriſt; love's ſtrong as death:
the Gentiles call: Chriſts coming ſhe prayeth.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: A 'Plaint of Judahs ſins, plagues; ſervice vain:
with promiſe, threats, he warns to turn again.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: By Chriſts reign call'd the Gentiles are, Wars ceaſe:
God leaves a Land for pride, and ſins encreaſe.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Confuſion comes by ſin; Jews ſhameleſs grown:
their Rulers gripes, and womans pride are ſhown.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: During the time of ills extremity,
Chriſts Kingdom ſhall be beſt ſecurity.

lg.label: chapter 5
lg.l: Excus'd's by Vineyards parable Gods wrath:
the covetous, wanton, vile, unjuſt, threats hath.

lg.label: chapter 6
lg.l: From Heav'n by Viſion Iſay's call is ſhown:
for ſtubborneſs (few ſav'd) the Jews o'rethrown.

lg.label: chapter 7
lg.l: 'Gainſt fear of foe Iſaiah comfort brings,
promiſeth Chriſt: from Aſhur Jew's wo ſprings.

lg.label: chapter 8
lg.l: Now Aſhur Syrians and all Jews ſubdues:
Gods judgment's ſure; comfort to his accrews.

lg.label: chapter 9
lg.l: In trouble joy by Chriſts birth: hypocrites,
impenitent, proud, the Lord with threatning ſmites.

lg.label: chapter 10
lg.l: Kingdom and birth of Chriſt midſt woes joys bring:
threats for hypocriſie, pride, not turning.

lg.label: chapter 11
lg.l: Learn here Chriſts peaceful reign, the Gentiles call:
the Jews glorious reſtore; their enemies fall.

lg.label: chapter 12
lg.l: Mercies in that day ſhall cauſe Zion ſing
a joyful Pſalm of thanks to Iſr'ls King.

lg.label: chapter 13
lg.l: Now God in wrath d • aws up his hoſt: the Medes
'gainſt Babylon, it to deſtroy, he leads.

lg.label: chapter 14
lg.l: Of Jacobs reſtore, triumph, inſultation
o're Babel; Aſhurs, Paleſtines vaſtation.

lg.label: chapter 15
lg.l: Pour'd out for Moab's ſtate is lamentation:
her Cities do lament their deſolation.

lg.label: chapter 16
lg.l: Quickned is Moab Chriſts reign to obey;
threatned for pride, bewail'd her diſmal day.

lg.label: chapter 17
lg.l: Read threats 'gainſt Syria, Jacob; Idols ſome
flee, plagu'd the reſt: on Iſr'els foes woes come.

lg.label: chapter 18
lg.l: Subdu'd ſhall Aethiop' be; and the ſucceſs
ſhall be the Churches plentiful increaſe.

lg.label: chapter 19
lg.l: The fall of Aegypt, her Peers fools; yet ſhe,
Aſhur, and Iſrael, one Church ſhall be.

lg.label: chapter 20
lg.l: Under a Type, by Iſay, figur'd is
Aegypt and Aethiops Captivities.

lg.label: chapter 21
lg.l: Arabia, Jacob, Edoms, overthrow:
on Tema, Kedar, God his wath doth ſhow.

lg.label: chapter 22
lg.l: Bold Perſians Jews invade, Jews policies,
joys checkt: Eliakim Chriſt typifies.

lg.label: chapter 23
lg.l: Come down muſt Tyre, yet after ſeventy years,
although unhappy, her return appears.

lg.label: chapter 24
lg.l: Deſpoil'd by Gods juſt judgments is the Land:
a remnant praiſing God with joy ſhall ſtand.

lg.label: chapter 25
lg.l: Eaalted God is for his Judgments ſhown;
his ſaving benefits, ſalvation.

lg.label: chapter 26
lg.l: For his Judgments this ſong calls; on God truſt:
for his love to his, wait on him we muſt.

lg.label: chapter 27
lg.l: God for his Vineyard cares: his chaſtiſements,
and judgments differ; Church of Jews and Gents.

lg.label: chapter 28
lg.l: Here drunkards, proud, indocible, ſecure
threatned; others ſafe in Chriſt, a rock ſure.

lg.label: chapter 29
lg.l: Judg'd are Jeruſalems dullards, hypocrites:
inſatiate are her foes; joy ſhall meek ſp'rites.

lg.label: chapter 30
lg.l: Keen's God's wrath 'gainſt man-truſt, ſleighting his word:
Gods grace to 's Church; ſhe joys in Aſhurs rod.

lg.label: chapter 31
lg.l: Like's their woe who truſt Aegypt, leave the Lord:
Converſion's preſt: Aſhur ſhall fall by th'ſword.

lg.label: chapter 32
lg.l: Much bleſſings from Chriſts reign; deſtruction
foretold; and promis'd reſtauration.

lg.label: chapter 33
lg.l: No foes of Gods Church are from judgments free:
the godlies priviledges what they be.

lg.label: chapter 34
lg.l: Of judgments 'gainſt Gods Churches enemy;
their overthrow: certain's the Propheſie.

lg.label: chapter 35
lg.l: Proſperous joy, ſhall from Chriſts Kingdom flow
from Goſpel virtues let the weak ſtrong grow.

lg.label: chapter 36
lg.l: Rabſhekah blaſphemes, it's told Hezekiah.

lg.label: chapter 37
lg.l: Rais'd is Iſay the Kings grief to allay:
an Angel Aſhurs Hoſt, his ſons him ſlay.

lg.label: chapter 38
lg.l: Sent's a death meſſage; the Kings prayer gains
a longer life: thanks God with ſinging ſtrains.

lg.label: chapter 39
lg.l: To Babels Nuncio his wealth Hezeky
ſhews: Iſay foretells Jews Captivity.

lg.label: chapter 40
lg.l: Vulg'd's the Goſpel: What John, the Apoſtles preach:
Gods pow'r, preheminence, his, comfort teach.

lg.label: chapter 41
lg.l: About Gods mercies, promiſe, vanity
of Idols, with his people reaſons he.

lg.label: chapter 42
lg.l: Behold Chriſt meek and conſtant; wherefore ſent:
praiſe God for him; incredulous are ſhent.

lg.label: chapter 43
lg.l: Church cheer'd with promiſe: Gods power men witneſs;
Babels fall; his are ſafe; Jews excuſeleſs.

lg.label: chapter 44
lg.l: Dumb Idols vain; their makers fooliſhneſs:
For Gods redemption, power, his praiſe expreſs.

lg.label: chapter 45
lg.l: Eſtabliſht Cyrus is, for Churches good:
by Gods power men are to obedience woo'd.

lg.label: chapter 46
lg.l: Faln Nebo, Bell; God his to th'end doth ſave:
Idols with God no competition have.

lg.label: chapter 47
lg.l: Gods judgments on Chaldea, for their pride,
mercyleſneſs, o'reboldneſs, none can abide.

lg.label: chapter 48
lg.l: Hypocrites, perverſe Jews checkt, Gods goodneſs;
he call's t'obey, bewails their backwardneſs.

lg.label: chapter 49
lg.l: Jews Chriſt ſent to, in vain; the Gentiles Call:
Gods conſtant love; his Church reſtore he ſhall.

lg.label: chapter 50
lg.l: Know Chriſt leaves Jews, from no defect to ſave,
or obey: truſts Gods help; our truſt doth crave.

lg.label: chapter 51
lg.l: Learn faith in Chriſt from Abr'am; he defends
his: Jews afflictions wails, deliverance ſends.

lg.label: chapter 52
lg.l: Much comfort to Gods Church; receiv'd muſt be
his Miniſters, Chriſts reign exalted high.

lg.label: chapter 53
lg.l: None or few believe Chriſt; his Croſs is freed
from ſhame, by paſſion-fruits, and its good ſpeed.

lg.label: chapter 54
lg.l: Of Gentile Churches largeneſs, ſafety, glory;
Gods their deliverer, conſervatory.

lg.label: chapter 55
lg.l: Proclaim'd is Chriſts free call, him to receive,
repent; their happy ſucceſs who believe.

lg.label: chapter 56
lg.l: Quickned they are to be juſt, keep Gods day;
with promiſes: blind watchmen he will ſlay.

lg.label: chapter 57
lg.l: Righteous mens death is bleſſed; God reproves
the ſinful Jews: the penitents he loves.

lg.label: chapter 58
lg.l: Smooth Hypocrites reprov'd; faſts falſe and true
ſhown: Promiſes to Sabbath-keeping due.

lg.label: chapter 59
lg.l: Tranſgreſſion parts from God; woes ſinners haunt;
God only ſaves: the Saviours Covenant.

lg.label: chapter 60
lg.l: Unto the Church the Gentiles great acceſs:
ſhort troubles end in laſting bleſſedneſs.

lg.label: chapter 61
lg.l: Annointed's Chriſt, his Office, forwardneſs,
and bleſſings, which the faithful do poſſeſs.

lg.label: chapter 62
lg.l: Breathe promiſes doth Iſay, Church to ſtay:
Miniſters Goſpel-work muſt fit the way.

lg.label: chapter 63
lg.l: Chriſt ſhews who's his; what of foes his conqueſt;
mercy to his Church: her faith is profeſt.

lg.label: chapter 64
lg.l: Deſire the Church doth God his power to ſhow:
ſins natural confeſſeth, wails her woe.

lg.label: chapter 65
lg.l: Elect are Gentiles: Jews caſt off, ſav'd few:
the wicked plagu'd, bleſs'd ſtate of Salem new.

lg.label: chapter 66
lg.l: For humble, comforts, Churches benefits:
the Gentiles call; Judgments for ill God fits.

div.head: The Book Of the Propheſie of JEREMIAH.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: A Call to Jeremy: his Almond rod,
and Pot, ſhew Judahs plagues, help him will God.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: By former love God their revolt cauſleſs
pleads: they their ruine cauſe; their truſt vain is.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Call'd to repent Jews are of whoredoms paſt;
if penitent they ſhall Gods mercy taſte.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Drawn are Jews to turn by threats, promiſes:
a lamentation for their miſeries.

lg.label: chapter 5
lg.l: Expreſt are threats 'gainſt Jews 'cauſe obſtinate,
adulterers corrupt in Church and State.

lg.label: chapter 6
lg.l: For Judahs ſins deſtroying foes are ſent:
their ſins, Gods wrath, he calls them to repent.

lg.label: chapter 7
lg.l: God calls t'amend; vain's truſt in Temple, or
off'rings: God Idols, Tophet doth abhor.

lg.label: chapter 8
lg.l: He ſhews the Jews diſtreſs, impenitent.
upbraids; their judgments, deſp'rate ſtate laments.

lg.label: chapter 9
lg.l: Jews ſins and plagues he mourns; ſin brings the rod:
he calls to mourn, to truſt in none but God.

lg.label: chapter 10
lg.l: Know God's without compare; woes future flee:
Temple ſpoil'd for bad guides; his prayer ſee.

lg.label: chapter 11
lg.l: Learn cov'nant-breakers curſe; he threateneth mourn:
Anathoth men, for ſeeking of his death.

lg.label: chapter 12
lg.l: Much may the wicked thrive, but they ſhall
his falſe Brethren: the pen'tent ſhall return.

lg.label: chapter 13
lg.l: Note do wine-bottels, and girdle; their woes
prevention make; ſin is the cauſe of thoſe.

lg.label: chapter 14
lg.l: Outragious famine makes him pray, in vain;
falſe Prophets excuſe not; Jer. doth complain.

lg.label: chapter 15
lg.l: Paſt cure the Jews woes are: Jer. their ſpite wails,
prays; God them threats; with comfort him aſſails,

lg.label: chapter 16
lg.l: Quite-ruin'd Jews in types he doth foretel;
their return, that from Aegypt, ſhall excel.

lg.label: chapter 17
lg.l: Ruine for ſin, truſt in man curſt, deceit
of the heart: Sabbath-keepers bleſſing's great.

lg.label: chapter 18
lg.l: Shewn, by the Potters Type, 's Gods general ſway.
Revolters Judgments; he 'gainſt foes doth pray.

lg.label: chapter 19
lg.l: The potters veſſel broken doth foreſhow,
for their ſins, the Jews diſmal overthrow.

lg.label: chapter 20
lg.l: Vile Paſhurs doom for ſmiting Jeremy:
Jer. 'plains of his birth, contempt, treachery.

lg.label: chapter 21
lg.l: Anſwer is ſent the King, ſiege hard will be;
is counſell'd to fall to the Enemy.

lg.label: chapter 22
lg.l: By promiſe, threats, he wooes them to repent:
Shallims, Jehojakims, Coniahs judgment.

lg.label: chapter 23
lg.l: Cries againſt Paſtors falſe; though the flock have
diſperſed been, Chriſt ſhall them rule and ſave.

lg.label: chapter 24
lg.l: Deliv'rance of Captives by good figs ſhown;
by bad Zedekies deſolation known.

lg.label: chapter 25
lg.l: Evils of ſleighting Prophets; ſeventy years thrall:
after that Babels fall, then Nations all.

lg.label: chapter 26
lg.l: For preaching plagues, if Jews do not ſubmit;
the Prophet's caught, arraign'd, pleads, and is quit.

lg.label: chapter 27
lg.l: God by yokes, bonds, ſhews moſt ſhall Babel ſerve
warneth, that falſe Prophets no faith deſerve.

lg.label: chapter 28
lg.l: Hanani Jews return falſly ſpeaketh:
breaks Jeremi's yoke, an iron for't: his death.

lg.label: chapter 29
lg.l: Jews captiv'd, after ſeventy years ſet free;
the reſt 'ſtroy'd: three vile Prophets judgments ſee.

lg.label: chapter 30
lg.l: Kind's God to Jews in their return from thrall:
comforts them; wrath on the wicked ſhall fall.

lg.label: chapter 31
lg.l: Laments Rachel: Ephraim turns, brought home is:
Chriſt's proms'ed; his care, new foede; Church greatneſs.

lg.label: chapter 32
lg.l: Made faſt is Jer. his purchas'd field, ſad plaint:
ſin captiv'd them, grace will them freedom grant.

lg.label: chapter 33
lg.l: News of return, their joy; ſixt Government:
the Branch, Kingdoms, and Prieſthoods ſettlement.

lg.label: chapter 34
lg.l: Of bondmen free, and re-aſſum'd to thrall:
for which the Nation by their foes ſhall ſall.

lg.label: chapter 35
lg.l: Proud Jews condemned are, by th' obedience
of Rechabs ſeed, who bleſſed are from thence.

lg.label: chapter 36
lg.l: Quoted in roll Jews pleaſures are: Jehoi'kim
hears part, burns it: a new roll, woes 'gainſt him.

lg.label: chapter 37
lg.l: Rais'd is the ſiege; Chaldees ſhall come again:
Jer's beat, ſhut up, at laſt ſome grace doth gain.

lg.label: chapter 38
lg.l: Suit of the Moor Jer. from the dungeon clears;
the King he counſels; 'tis hid from the Peers.

lg.label: chapter 39
lg.l: The City burned is; the King made blinde:
Jeremy freed, to the Moor good aſſign'd.

lg.label: chapter 40
lg.l: Unto Gedali Jews come, Jeremy;
Johanan ſhews Iſhm'els conſpiracie.

lg.label: chapter 41
lg.l: After Gedali ſlain, Iſhmael flees
to Ammon: Johanan his Captives frees.

lg.label: chapter 42
lg.l: Blam'd is Johanans falſeneſs, Jeremy ſhows
in Jury ſafety, and in Aegypt woes.

lg.label: chapter 43
lg.l: Credit Joh'n gives not, Jeremy and Jews
to Aegypt Joh'n brings: Aegypts thrall enſues.

lg.label: chapter 44
lg.l: Deſtroy'd are Jews there, for Idolatry
and ſtubborneſs; Aegypt ſhall Captive be.

lg.label: chapter 45
lg.l: Encouraged is Baruch, he ſhall not
with others fall; ſafety ſhall be his lot.

lg.label: chapter 46
lg.l: Fall Pharaohs Army ſhall at Euphrates
by Babels King; Jews comfort in diſtreſs.

lg.label: chapter 47
lg.l: Great is Philiſtims ruine by the ſword:
cannot be ſheath'd, 'cauſe charged by the Lord.

lg.label: chapter 48
lg.l: Howl Moab ſhall for her ſecurity,
contempt, fleſh-confidence, deſtroy'd ſhall be.

lg.label: chapter 49
lg.l: Judgments upon the Ammonites, Edom,
Damaſcus, Kedar, Hazor, and Elam.

lg.label: chapter 50
lg.l: Know Babels Judgments here, and deſtiny;
Iſr'el from bondage then ſhall be ſet free.

lg.label: chapter 51
lg.l: Large Babels Judgments are in Euphrates;
Jer's Book caſt ſhews their ſinking ſhall not ceaſe.

lg.label: chapter 52
lg.l: Made blinde, childleſs, 'cauſe rebel's Zedeki'
Salem deſtroy'd, advanc'd is Jechoni'.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: ALas! ſad State for ſins, Salem complains,
her grief: confeſſeth God juſt in her pain.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: Bewailing Jeruſalems miſery;
he in complaints thereof to God doth cry.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Calamities the Saints lament; in God
hope: God is juſt, pray him withdraw his rod.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Declar'd is Zions pitiful eſtate:
her ſins confeſt; her comforts, Edoms fate.

lg.label: chapter 5
lg.l: Enlarg'd by prayer, Zion doth relate
unto the Lord her lamentable ſtate.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: AT what time propheſi'd Ezekiel,
the four wheels, Cherub'd Viſions he doth tell.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: By Commiſſion, inſtruction, he is taught
to ſpeak 'gainſt ſins; a heavy roll is brought.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Cheer'd by God eats the roll; that gains him skill:
rules for him; muſt be dumb; ſpeak, when God will.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Drawn by a ſieges type, is ſignifi'd
Jews long defection, a dearth propheſi'd.

lg.label: chapter 5
lg.l: Expreſt's by hair, burnt, cut, and in wind thrown,
judgments by famine, ſword, diſperſion.

lg.label: chapter 6
lg.l: For Idols Iſr'ls woes, (a remnant bleſt:)
he's call'd to mourn for Iſr'el ſore diſtreſt.

lg.label: chapter 7
lg.l: Grieve ſhall th'eſcap'd for Iſr'el deſolate:
a chain-Type ſhews the Captives ſad eſtate.

lg.label: chapter 8
lg.l: Hear Judahs ſins by worſhip that were done
to Jealouſie, to Tammuz, and the Sun.

lg.label: chapter 9
lg.l: Inkt-markt are ſome for ſafety, the reſt are
deſtroy'd; the Prophet ſues, God will not ſpare.

lg.label: chapter 10
lg.l: Kindled coals o're the City ſcatter'd be:
the Viſion of the Cherubs and wheels, ſee.

lg.label: chapter 11
lg.l: Lewd Peers are judg'd, reſt ſav'd, glory forſakes
Salem: to Chaldee God Ezekiel takes.

lg.label: chapter 12
lg.l: Moving and trembling of Ezekiel ſhows
Jews bondage, ruine; the ſpeed of their woes.

lg.label: chapter 13
lg.l: No peace to falſe Prophets, who falſe peace ſhow:
nor Propheteſſes who do pillows ſow.

lg.label: chapter 14
lg.l: Obſtinate anſwer'd, as they ſinn'd, plagues ſpread:
Noah, Job, Daniel ſave but their own head.

lg.label: chapter 15
lg.l: Prepra'd Jeruſalem for fire ſhall be;
as Vine-branch which for no uſe fit we ſee.

lg.label: chapter 16
lg.l: Quaintly a new born child Jeruſ'lems ſtate,
and Gods free grace, ſhews; her whoredoms ſad fate.

lg.label: chapter 17
lg.l: Revolt to Aegypt the Jews may, not ſave
from Babel: fruit the Goſpels plant ſhall have.

lg.label: chapter 18
lg.l: Sour-grape Proverb reprov'd: each man ſhall dy
for his own ſins: God's juſt: from all ſins fly.

lg.label: chapter 19
lg.l: Two Lyons caught in pit with waſte vine ſhow
Iſraels Kings, Jeruſalems overthrow.

lg.label: chapter 20
lg.l: Vain are Jews praiſers, oft revolts, return
promis'd: as a foreſt Salem ſhall burn.

lg.label: chapter 21
lg.l: A ſword for ſlaughter; fall ſhall Iſr'els King;
God ſhall deſtruction upon Ammon bring.

lg.label: chapter 22
lg.l: Burnt the baſe droſs, Jeruſalem ſhall be
for ſins: whoſe Catalogues here you may ſee:

lg.label: chapter 23
lg.l: Crimes, plagues of Salem and Samaria;
by names of Aholah and Aholibah.

lg.label: chapter 24
lg.l: Deſcrib'd by Pot, Prophets dead wife not mourn'd;
Jews woes paſt grief: the City to be burn'd.

lg.label: chapter 25
lg.l: Edom, Lots ſeed, and Philiſtims ſhall feel
for inſolence 'gainſt Jews Gods angry ſteel.

lg.label: chapter 26
lg.l: Fall muſt proud Tyre, by Babels King, ſith he
vaunted over Jeruſalems miſery.

lg.label: chapter 27
lg.l: Great were the ſupplies of rich Tyre, yet ſhall
without hope of recovery be her fall.

lg.label: chapter 28
lg.l: Haughtineſs ſinks Tyres Prince; ſhown is Gods word
'gainſt Zidon, Iſrael ſhall be reſtor'd.

lg.label: chapter 29
lg.l: Judgments on Aegypt, yet reſtor'd; the hire
ſhe is of Babels Kings ſervice 'gainſt Tyre.

lg.label: chapter 30
lg.l: Kickt down is Aegypt, Babyloniſh arm
is ſtrengthned to procure th'Aegyptian harm.

lg.label: chapter 31
lg.l: Like Babels King in glory and in pride
is Aegypt, and muſt her ruine abide.

lg.label: chapter 32
lg.l: Made's lamentation for Aegypt deſtroy'd:
about which Babylons ſword is employ'd.

lg.label: chapter 33
lg.l: Next watchmens duty and Gods juſtice ſee.
who mock Gods Prophets ſhall feel miſery.

lg.label: chapter 34
lg.l: Of judgments 'gainſt ill Shepherds; God provides
for his own flock; their Shepherd Chriſt them guides.

lg.label: chapter 35
lg.l: Plagu'd ſhall mount Seir with great judgments be;
for troubling Iſrael in miſery.

lg.label: chapter 36
lg.l: Quite 'ſtroy'd their ſpiteful foes; Gods bleſs: they gain;
reſtor'd without deſert: Chriſts happy reign.

lg.label: chapter 37
lg.l: Reviv'd is Iſr'els hope from dead bones rais'd;
two ſticks made one; Chriſts reign promis'd and prais'd.

lg.label: chapter 38
lg.l: Stirr'd up are Gog and Magog to conteſt
with Jews; their power, deſtruction is expreſt.

lg.label: chapter 39
lg.l: The Jews conqueſt, Gogs judgment, burial;
fowls feaſt, Jews plagu'd for ſin, gather'd be ſhall.

lg.label: chapter 40
lg.l: Viſion of new Salem, time, end, deſcrib'd:
the gates, tables, chambers, and porch how wide.

lg.label: chapter 41
lg.l: After the meaſures, parts, and chambers length
are ſhewn, the Temples ornaments and ſtrength.

lg.label: chapter 42
lg.l: Both chambers and their uſe are marked out
for Prieſts: the outward Court meaſur'd about.

lg.label: chapter 43
lg.l: Come back Gods glory is; ſin doth it let:
Repent they muſt; Altars Laws down are ſet.

lg.label: chapter 44
lg.l: Deſign'd's the gate to Peers; no Prieſt abuſe
the Houſe may; their rites: God Zadok doth chuſe.

lg.label: chapter 45
lg.l: Expreſt portions of Land are for theſe three,
the City, Temple, Kings; for Kings Laws ſee.

lg.label: chapter 46
lg.l: For King and peoples worſhip Laws we find;
Kings Heritage, Court for Cook'ry aſſign'd.

lg.label: chapter 47
lg.l: Guſh holy waters from the Temple, and
their virtues; the bounds, parting of the Land.

lg.label: chapter 48
lg.l: Here parts for Tribes, Temple and City, are
ſet forth; the Princes, Cities bounds how far.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: AShpenaz doth Daniel (with three more) ſhow
the Chaldees skill; they eat pulſe, wiſe, fair grow.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: By Daniel the Kings loſt dream here is found,
expounded; wiſe-men ſav'd; Daniel renown'd.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Contriv'd's an Image; Dan's three mates deny
worſhip: in fornace caſt, ſav'd wondrouſly.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Declare the King a Dream doth, none expoun'd
it can: Dan. doth; the truth thereof is found.

lg.label: chapter 5
lg.l: Eye doth the King a writing on the wall;
Daniel expounds it, th'event ſo doth fall.

lg.label: chapter 6
lg.l: For praying Daniel is to Lyons caſt:
he's ſav'd; on's foes the Lyons feed full faſt.

lg.label: chapter 7
lg.l: Giv'n of four beaſts a Viſion is; Gods reign;
the meaning thereof Daniel doth obtain.

lg.label: chapter 8
lg.l: His viſion of two Rams, days of purgation;
Gabriel cheers him, gives th' interpretation.

lg.label: chapter 9
lg.l: Jews bondage-time Dan. muſing, ſin confeſſeth;
the ſeventy weeks ſenſe Gabriel expreſſeth.

lg.label: chapter 10
lg.l: Kept having himſelf low, Daniel doth ſee
a Viſion, troubled, comforted is he.

lg.label: chapter 11
lg.l: Leagues, fights, 'tween South North Kings: Perſias o'rethrow
by Greece: Romans invade, and Tyrants grow.

lg.label: chapter 12
lg.l: Michael ſhall Iſr'el from trouble free;
Daniel inform'd is when thoſe times ſhall be.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: ALl whordom ſpiritual judg'd by a whore
that Hoſeah takes; Jacobs ſeeds reſtore.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: Becauſe of Idols, threatned is the Nation;
on their return promis'd is con-donation.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Come Jacob ſee thy woes 'fore reſtauration;
ſhewn by'n Adultereſs her expiation.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Deſtruction Prieſt and peoples ſins do call
for; Judah is warn'd by his Brothers fall.

lg.label: chapter 5
lg.l: Evils 'gainſt Iſr'el, cauſe they're proud, unjuſt,
revolters, ſtubborn, and on Creatures truſt.

lg.label: chapter 6
lg.l: From ſin return, (ſaith God) but all in vain:
perverſneſs and their ſins make God complain.

lg.label: chapter 7
lg.l: God manifold iniquities eſpies;
is wroth againſt them for Hypocriſies.

lg.label: chapter 8
lg.l: Hir'd lovers, calves, built Temples, nought can ceaſe
Iſraels judgments, for their wickedneſs.

lg.label: chapter 9
lg.l: Iſraels fore diſtreſs, Captivity
threatned for ſin and their Idolatry.

lg.label: chapter 10
lg.l: King and people are checkt, and threatned by
God for their Idols and impiety.

lg.label: chapter 11
lg.l: Love ſhewn to Iſr'el ſhews they thankleſs be
to God; their judgments, and Gods mercies ſee.

lg.label: chapter 12
lg.l: Mov'd to repentance by Gods former love
is Ephraim; his vile ways do the Lord move.

lg.label: chapter 13
lg.l: Nipt's Ephraims glory through Idols; God vext
for his rebellions, pride; mercy's annext.

lg.label: chapter 14
lg.l: O Iſrael return, and ſeek Gods face;
diſclaim vain truſt, with bleſſings he'l you grace.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: A Dearth Joel foretels, exhorts to mourn;
preſcribes a general Faſt to God to turn.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: By ſhewing Gods fierce wrath, he cries repent,
faſt: comforts, promiſes, future, preſent.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Come God will judg his foes, and will be known
in Judgment; how he'l bleſs his Church, is ſhown.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: AMos on Syria, Tyrus, Moab, and
Philiſtia, Ammon, ſhews Gods heavy hand.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: Blown is Gods wrath 'gainſt Moab, Jacobs ſeed:
God complains their thankleſneſs doth exceed.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Chaſtiz'd is Jacob, the neceſſity;
injuſtice, violence are the cauſes why.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Declaim he doth againſt oppreſſion, and
Idols; their ſtubborneſs under Gods hand.

lg.label: chapter 5
lg.l: Exhorting to repent he doth lament
Jacob, God their feign'd ſervice doth not ſcent.

lg.label: chapter 6
lg.l: For wantonneſs Iſr'el is deſolate:
Judgment turn'd into gall ſpeaks their ſad fate.

lg.label: chapter 7
lg.l: Graſhoppers, fire, remov'd; Amazi' plains
'gainſt Amos; he thereby deſtruction gains.

lg.label: chapter 8
lg.l: Haſtes Iſraels end, a fruitful basket ſho'es;
a famine of the word; oppreſſors woes.

lg.label: chapter 9
lg.l: Iſr'el deſtroy'd ſhall be. In the laſt days,
God Davids Tabernacle up will raiſe.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: A Fall on Edoms pride, and injury,
ſpeaks Obad. Jacobs ſafety, victory.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: AS Jonah flees, a Tempeſt him bewrays:
he's caſt in Seas, kept by a whale three days.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: By fervent pray'r the whale is forc'd to ſtand
and vomit Jonah ſafe upon dry land.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Come ſafe to ſhore to Niniveh he's ſent:
on their repentance Gods wrath they prevent.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Diſpleaſed that God mercy doth afford
to Niniveh, reprov'd is by a gourd.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: AGainſt Jacob for Idols God is ſore
wroth: he exhorts to mourn and ſin no more.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: Blood-ſuckers wo, mourn'd; checkt Idolatry,
and injuſtice: Jacob reſtor'd ſhall be.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Cruel are Princes, Prophets falſhood cry;
yet both of them live in ſecurity.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Deſcrib'd is here the Churches great encreaſe;
her glory, Kingdom, victory, and peace.

lg.label: chapter 5
lg.l: Ephratah 's Chriſts birth-place; his Kingdoms length:
his foes deſtroy'd by his victorious ſtrength.

lg.label: chapter 6
lg.l: For their unkindneſs Gods controverſie;
injuſtice, ignorance, impiety.

lg.label: chapter 7
lg.l: Great ſins her number ſmall makes, Church complain,
truſts in God; vaunts o're foes: doth comfort gain.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: AGainſt Gods foes (ſaith Nahum) 's wrath is juſt:
but his goodneſs to them that in him truſt.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: Before God come the ſins of Niniveh;
Gods Army 'gainſt her, and its victory.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: A Plaint of Habakkuk for wrong judgment,
ſtrife, wealth-truſt; Chaldeans againſt them ſent.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: By Faith he muſt wait anſwer; woes here ſee,
for riot, avarice, and cruelty.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Cry unto God he doth, fears his great power;
by faith joyeth in God, as his ſtrong Tower.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: AGainſt Judah judgments ſhews Zephany;
for Idols, pride, deceit, ſecurity.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: Before wrath comes he warns them to ſeek God;
Philiſtims, Aethiops, Aſſurs, Lot ſeeds rod.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Checkt are Jews Princes, Prieſts, their reſtauration
wait for they muſt; rejoyce in their ſalvation.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: A Check gives Haggai for Temples neglect:
their labour's curſt: bids build, God will protect.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: By ſecond Temples glory farther'd is
the work; ſins hinder: Zerubbabels bliſs.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: AMend (ſaith Zechary;) an Angel prayeth;
comforts enſue: three Viſions he diſplayeth.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: By Gods care meaſur'd is Jeruſalem:
Zions freedom; Gods preſence promis'd them.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Chriſt the Branch promis'd: Joſhuah ſignifies
the Jews return from their Captivities.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Declar'd's by Candleſtick Temples good ſpeed;
by two Trees, two Annointed Ones, here read.

lg.label: chapter 5
lg.l: Expreſs doth flying roll thieves, ſwearers woes;
the woman preſs'd doth Babels fall diſcloſe.

lg.label: chapter 6
lg.l: Four char'ots 'twixt the mountain; Joſhuahs crown,
ſhews Chriſt the Branch, his Temple, and renown.

lg.label: chapter 7
lg.l: Gain ſaid's their faſt, for faſt they do in vain;
ſin the chief cauſe that captive they remain.

lg.label: chapter 8
lg.l: Jeruſalems return, wall'd, peopl'd; God
good works requires; gives joy, takes off the rod.

lg.label: chapter 9
lg.l: Jah ſhields his Church, Zion muſt joyful be
for Chriſt; coming: promis'd is victory.

lg.label: chapter 10
lg.l: Kneel down to God we muſt; Idols reject:
as God whips his for ſin, ſo he'l protect.

lg.label: chapter 11
lg.l: Low laid is Salem, good ſav'd, others ſlain;
Beauty, bands ſtaves broke; woes 'gainſt ſhepherds vain.

lg.label: chapter 12
lg.l: Made Salem is to fear; a ſtumbling ſtone
to foes; the Jews return, and mourning ſhown.

lg.label: chapter 13
lg.l: Now Salem's purg'd from Idols, propheſie
falſe; a third refined: Chriſt muſt die.

lg.label: chapter 14
lg.l: O' •… thrown is Salem, Chriſt comes, they ſhall ſmart
that ſtroy it; to the Lord ſhall turn a part.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: A 'Plaint of Malachi for unkindneſs;
Iſr'els prophaneſs, irreligiouſneſs.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: Blam'd are Prieſts, Covenant-breach; adultery
of people; Idols infidelity.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Chriſts Meſſenger, grace, glory; ſtubborneſs,
ſacriledg checkt: God-fearers happineſs.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Day of fire meets the wicked, light the juſt:
Elijah firſt come to prepare men muſt.

div.trailer: The end of the Old TESTAMENT.

div.head: The order of times wherein the Prophets propheſied; being a help to ſuch as deſire to read them in order.
div.l: JOnas excell'd for his Prophetick ſtrain,
When Jeroboam the Second did reign.
Liv'd, reigning Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz,
And Hezeki'. In the three laſt Kings reign
Micah did his Commiſſion obtain.
Next Nahum, Habakkuk, and Zephany,
In King Joſiahs reign did Propheſie.
Jeremy in Joſiahs reign, until
Th' eleventh of Zedeki', foretold Gods will.
Obadiah is thought to Propheſie,
A contemporary with Jeremy.
Daniel from the third of Jehoiakim
Until the third year of Cyruo: with him
In the fifth of Jehoiakims bondage
Ezekiel nineteen years did preſage.
Haggai and Zechariah did begin
The ſecond year of Darius the King.
Malachi thought is to have propheſi'd
After the Temple was re-edifi'd.
After him Propheſie did ceaſe, until
Chriſt the great Prophet came, a • l to fulfil.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: ABr'ams race; Chriſts conception, birth, and Name
an Angel ſhews; his Mother's free from blame.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: By Wiſe-mens coming Herod's mov'd; adore
they Chriſt: Beth'lems babes ſlain; Chriſts flight before.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Clothes, Doctrine, Baptiſm of John; by a Dove
Chriſt' (by him baptiz'd) is ſhewn from above.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Days fourty Chriſt faſts, 's tempted: Satans lures
he checks: 'gins to preach, diſciple, work cures.

lg.label: chapter 5
lg.l: Earths ſalt & light; who bleſt; the Law ſtands-luſt,
killing, oaths, curb'd; bear wrong, love foes, we muſt.

lg.label: chapter 6
lg.l: Forgive, give alms, pray, faſt, carking cares flee.
truſt God, one Maſter ſerve, heav'n firſt ſeek ye.

lg.label: chapter 7
lg.l: Give no raſh judgment, nor pearl to ſwine; pray:
flee wolves; the wiſe builder; take the ſtrait way.

lg.label: chapter 8
lg.l: Heal'd's ſouldier, leper, Peter's mother, wind
ſtill'd, ſwine drown'd; poſſeſt brought to their right mind.

lg.label: chapter 9
lg.l: Jeſus the palſie cures; calls Matth. doth eat
with ſinners, flux cures, why his faſt not yet.
Jairus daughter is rais'd, two blind men ſee;
a dumb ſpeaks: Chriſt the people doth pity.

lg.label: chapter 10
lg.l: Know here, Chriſt ſends forth twelve with wonders, power;
their charge, comfort; bleſt they who them ſuccour.

lg.label: chapter 11
lg.l: Large is Chriſts praiſe of John; Bethſaida's wo:
Babes Goſpel know; lade Souls to Chriſt muſt go.

lg.label: chapter 12
lg.l: Mark ſabbath-works, reſtor'd's blind-dumb poſſeſt;
a parted houſe falls; fruit the tree ſhews beſt.
Matchleſs blaſphemy; vain words: Chriſt none other
ſign will give but Jonas; his Mother, Brother.

lg.label: chapter 13
lg.l: Next, parables of ſeed, tares, muſtard, net,
hid wealth, leav'n, pearl, Chriſts neighbours him light ſet.

lg.label: chapter 14
lg.l: Of Chriſt Herods conceit; he walks on main:
feeds five thouſand; his hem toucht heals; John's ſlain.

lg.label: chapter 15
lg.l: Prov'd vile traditions are; what defiles man;
four thouſand fed; cur'd a woman of Canaan.

lg.label: chapter 16
lg.l: Quipt are ſign-ſeeking Phariſees: their leaven
take heed; mens thoughts, & Peters of Chriſt given.
Quaſh Chriſt doth his rebuke, when his death tell;
deny ſelf; the world gain'd is loſs with hell.

lg.label: chapter 17
lg.l: Read Chriſts transform; ſome ſp'rites by faſting, prayer
caſt out; Chriſts death ſhewn: he a tribute-payer.

lg.label: chapter 18
lg.l: Shew lowlineſs, offences flee, ſheep loſt;
Church keys, forgive, hard meaſure dear will coſt.

lg.label: chapter 19
lg.l: Treats of divorce, wedlock; babes Chriſt doth take;
rich hardly ſav'd; for Chriſt beſt all forſake.

lg.label: chapter 20
lg.l: Vine-dreſſers hir'd, Chriſts ſuff'rings foretold be;
Zebedees wifes requeſt; two blind men ſee.

lg.label: chapter 21
lg.l: An Aſs bears Chriſt: Temple purg'd, curs'd fig-tree;
two ſtubborn ſons; heir-killing farmers ſee.

lg.label: chapter 22
lg.l: Bride-feaſt o'th Prince; Chriſt toll pays; riſe ſhall all:
the firſt precept; David Chriſt Lord doth call.

lg.label: chapter 23
lg.l: Chriſt ſaith, hear Phariſees, their ways decline:
woes 'gainſt theſe hypocrites: Salems ruine.

lg.label: chapter 24
lg.l: Deſtruction of the Temple; judgment day
foretold, the ſigns; time unknown; watch alway.

lg.label: chapter 25
lg.l: Equall'd to ten Virgins is heavens Kingdom,
and talents; deſcrib'd is the day of doom.

lg.label: chapter 26
lg.l: Fell plots 'gainſt Chriſt: he 'nointed is and ſold;
th' Euchariſt: traytor; Peters fall foretold.
Forth Chriſt goes, prays; ſeiz'd, Peter fights; all fly,
Jews do falſe charge, abuſe; Peter deny.

lg.label: chapter 27
lg.l: Grave Pilate's Judg; his wifes dream: Judas dead;
Chriſt caſt is, crown'd, mock'd, croſs fixt grave watched.

lg.label: chapter 28
lg.l: His riſe an Angel ſhews; Soldiers brib'd are:
th' Apoſtles ſee him, are ſent near and far.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: A Baptiſt John; Chriſt baptiz'd, tempted, preacheth:
calls Peter, Andrew, James, John; mercy reacheth.
A man poſſeſt; heal'd is Peters wives Mother:
cleans'd is a leper, cured many other.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: By Chriſt the palſy's heal'd: Levies call, feaſt;
Diſciples faſt not: pluck ears, why' • expreſt.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Chriſt heal'd the dri'd hand, chuſeth twelve; doth other
cures: his pow'r clears o're ſp'rites; ſhews who's his Brother.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Diverſly ſeed falls; Light muſt not hid be:
ſeeds ſecret growth: ſtorm calm'd: the muſtard tree.

lg.label: chapter 5
lg.l: Expuls'd is Legion; ſwine into Sea driven:
flax of blood cur'd: Jairus daughter reviven.

lg.label: chapter 6
lg.l: Forth are twelve ſent, return, Chriſt's ſcorn'd: John ſlain;
five loaves feaſt; touchers heal'd; Chriſt walks on th'main.

lg.label: chapter 7
lg.l: 'Gainſt unwaſht eating: Corban: Jews tradition:
deaf ſtammerer cur'd; ſp'rit leaves Syrophenician.

lg.label: chapter 8
lg.l: He feeds four thouſand; warns 'gainſt leav'n: a ſign
denies; he's Chriſt: his death ſhwes: ſelf reſign.

lg.label: chapter 9
lg.l: Jeſus face ſhines: Eli's come: ſp'rit unclean
caſt out by pray'r; as babes your ſelves demean.

lg.label: chapter 10
lg.l: Know divorce laws: wealths danger; children bleſt;
Bartimy ſees: loſs for Chriſt's the gain beſt.

lg.label: chapter 11
lg.l: Lowly rides Chriſt: fig-tree curſt; Temple purg'd:
forgive foes; to clear Chriſt power John is urg'd.

lg.label: chapter 12
lg.l: Murder Husbandmen act; Jews caſt off: call'd
the Gentiles: Tribute paid: Sadduces maul'd.
Mark the firſt precept: Scribes are Hypocrites,
them heed: Chriſt's Davids Son, the widows mites.

lg.label: chapter 13
lg.l: Notes of the Temples ruine, Judgment day;
the time unknown, be ready, watch and pray.

lg.label: chapter 14
lg.l: Of plots 'gainſt Chriſt; rich oyntment: Judas ſale;
the Traytor ſhewn: laſt Supper, flee ſhall all.
Of Judas kiſs: Chriſt's arreſt, accuſation;
condemn'd by Prieſts, abus'd; Peters ploration.

lg.label: chapter 15
lg.l: Pilate condemns Chriſt, Barabbas to free;
he's crown'd, mockt, condemn'd, bears his fatal tree.
Plac'd 'tween thieves; Jews rail; eclipſe, Temples vail
rent; Chriſts Godhead confeſt: his burial.

lg.label: chapter 16
lg.l: Quickned he is: an Angel therewith chears
three women: Chriſt to Magdalen appears.
Queſtions with two towards Emmaus; ſends
th'Apoſtles through the world: to Heaven aſcends.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: A Preface: John, Chriſt conceiv'd, John born is:
Elizabeths, Maries, Zech'ries Propheſies.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: Brave Caeſars tax: Chriſts birth; angels ſwains carry
news of: Chriſt's circumcis'd, purifi'd Mary.
Both Simeon and Ann Propheſie: Chriſts grace:
diſputes with Doctors: gives parents their place.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Chriſt's witneſs'd by John: Johns work, 'priſonment:
a dove and voice ſhew Chriſt; his age, deſcent.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Defeat doth Chriſt Satan; begins to preach;
his fame Naz'reth, Capernaum doth reach.
Devils caſt out confeſs him, Peters Mother,
with more cur'd; Chriſt preacheth through Cities other.

lg.label: chapter 5
lg.l: Entring a ſhip Chriſt doth teach, fiſhes take,
prays in deſert: the palſie whole doth make.
Eats with ſinners; when his Diſciples faſt
ſhall: new things put unto old will not laſt.

lg.label: chapter 6
lg.l: For Sabbath rules: twelve choſen: healed all.
Bleſſings, woes, good works, weak foundations fall.

lg.label: chapter 7
lg.l: Good Captains man is cur'd, rais'd widows ſon:
anſwers Johns meſſage; teſtifies of John.
Girds Jews, whom Johns, nor Chriſts manners could win.
Magdalens tears, love, forgiveneſs of ſin.

lg.label: chapter 8
lg.l: Heal'd-womens bounty: Sower, candle, who
are Chriſts kindred: winds are calm'd; Legion too
Haſte ſwines death; Chriſt reject do Gadarens:
he ſtops the flux, Jairus daughter quickens.

lg.label: chapter 9
lg.l: Jeſus ſends twelve: Herods deſire; Chriſt fed
five thouſand: what he is? Chriſt transformed.
Jeſus death's ſhewn: bids patient, humble be:
Samaria's churliſh: let dead dead bury.

lg.label: chapter 10
lg.l: Know Sev'nties work here: wherein to rejoyce:
church-ſtate happy: neighbor who's: Maries choice.

lg.label: chapter 11
lg.l: Learn how to pray: be earneſt, God hears his:
expuls'd's a ſp'rit, blaſpheme do Phariſees.
Law-keepers bleſt; Ninivites ſhall atteſt
'gainſt ſtubborn Jews: Phariſees woes expreſt.

lg.label: chapter 12
lg.l: Men fear not: leav'n heed: ſhun ſinful care:
the rich fool: watch for Chriſt: ſecure mens fare.

lg.label: chapter 13
lg.l: No ſafety ſans repentance: fruitleſs tree:
the crooked woman heal'd: the words pow'r ſee:
Next muſtard ſown, leav'n: paſs the ſtrait gate;
Herod's a Fox: Jeruſalems ſad fate.

lg.label: chapter 14
lg.l: On loweſt ſeat ſit: feaſt poor, gueſts excuſe:
forſake all: wiſe builder: ſalt not for uſe.

lg.label: chapter 15
lg.l: Parables of loſt ſheep, loſt groat, loſt Son,
ſhews Gods goodneſs to ſuch as from him run.

lg.label: chapter 16
lg.l: Quipt Hypocrites are; the ſteward unjuſt:
Lazarus Heav'n hath, Dives to hell thruſt.

lg.label: chapter 17
lg.l: Raiſe no ſcandal, forgive, works duties be:
ten lepers heal'd; Chriſt day comes ſuddenly.

lg.label: chapter 18
lg.l: See reſtleſs widow, Publicane, Babes bleſt.
wealth turns from Chriſt; forſake all: Chriſts death preſt.

lg.label: chapter 19
lg.l: Talents improv'd: turn'd Zachee: Chriſt rideth
to Salem, weeps; whips ſellers: ſought's his death.

lg.label: chapter 20
lg.l: Voucht's Chriſts power: farmers bane: toll paid: dead ſhall
riſe: Scribes falſe ſanctity's their greater fall.

lg.label: chapter 21
lg.l: A widows mites: ſigns of the Judgment day,
and Jeruſalems ruine: watch and pray.

lg.label: chapter 22
lg.l: Bold Jews plot, Judas ſale, his Treaſon ſhown
at the Paſch; thoſe muſt ſhun pride who him own.
Be foil'd not ſunk muſt Simon; Chriſt ſweats blood.
ſeiz'd Malchus heals; deni'd, wrong'd by men wood.

lg.label: chapter 23
lg.l: Chriſt Pilate ſends to Herod, they agree:
he's mockt, return'd, catcht Simon bears his tree.
Cry wives for your Babes; he for his foes doth crave:
the good thief: Captains faith; death & grave.

lg.label: chapter 24
lg.l: Declar'd's Chriſts riſe: ſeen by Emmaus men:
by the twelve, eats, his promiſe: mounts Heaven.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: ALl's made by the word, God-man; his office:
Johns evidence; Andrew, with more, call'd is.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: By Chriſt water's made wine, Temple purg'd, his ſhines:
death ſhewn: wonder-believers credit miſs.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Chriſts new-birth Doctrine: Gods love to man
damns unbelif: Johns baptiſm, teſt, Doctrines.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Diſcourſe at Jacobs well doth many gain:
Chriſts zeal; a Rulers Son doth health obtain.

lg.label: chapter 5
lg.l: Eas'd the Betheſda man: Jews fume, in vain:
who Chriſt is, many witneſſes make plain.

lg.label: chapter 6
lg.l: Five thouſand fed, the people would Chriſt King:
he walks on Seas, checks their after-flocking:
Fleſh-hearers too: He is the living bread;
Some him forſake: Peter owns his Godhead.

lg.label: chapter 7
lg.l: 'Gainſt Kinſmen Chriſt ſpeaks, to the Booth-feaſts goes:
preacheth; divers conceits of him aroſe.
Gnaſht at are Officers, 'cauſe Chriſt's not brought:
Nicodeme pleading for him is ill thought.

lg.label: chapter 8
lg.l: He frees th'Adult' reſs, is the worlds true light;
ſtops Jews boaſt of Abr'am: ſcapes their ſtones might.

lg.label: chapter 9
lg.l: Jeſus cures a blinde born; Jews him outcaſt:
Chriſt him receives, he believes Chriſt at laſt.

lg.label: chapter 10
lg.l: Know Chriſt the door, true ſhepherd, Son of God:
he 'ſcapes the Jews; beyond Jordan hath abode,

lg.label: chapter 11
lg.l: Lazarus rais'd; ſome ſhew faith: Phariſees
plot, at Paſch lay wait: Caiphas propheſies.

lg.label: chapter 12
lg.l: Mary 'noints Chriſt, Laz'rus ſight thereat ſeeks,
the Prieſts his death: Chriſt rides a colt; the Greeks
Move Chriſt to ſee; his death's ſhewn: the light's he:
Jews blinde: ſome chief believe, but ſecretly.

lg.label: chapter 13
lg.l: Not waſht, no part in Chriſt, the traytor's ſhown:
Diſciples muſt love; Peters fall's foreknown.

lg.label: chapter 14
lg.l: Our ſaith Chriſt claims; he fits a place: the way
is, one with the Father, in his Name pray.
Obedience, love, he calls for; promiſeth
the Comforter; his peace with his leaveth.

lg.label: chapter 15
lg.l: Preached is Chriſt the Vine; his members love:
comfort 'gainſt ſuff'rings; Jews excuſe leſs prove.

lg.label: chapter 16
lg.l: Queſtion'd, kill'd Chriſt muſt be, their pray'rs ſucceſs:
the Sp'rit ſhall have, its work, Chriſt is their peace.

lg.label: chapter 17
lg.l: Requeſt Chriſt doth his Father glorifie
me, mine, them keep in one, love, ſanctifie.

lg.label: chapter 18
lg.l: Souldiers come, fall to ground, off's Malehus ear:
Chriſt's ſeiz'd, tri'd, his Kingdom; robber ſet clear.

lg.label: chapter 19
lg.l: Thorns crown Chriſt, he's whipt, caſt, his coat ſeamles
dies. John takes Mary: his corps embalm'd is.

lg.label: chapter 20
lg.l: View Chriſts grave, Mary, Peter, John: he 'pears
to her, then to the twelve; Thomas doubt clears.

lg.label: chapter 21
lg.l: Again to his fiſhing, dines: Peters death
ſhews, feed his ſheep: touching John rebuketh.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: APoſtles Chriſt oft ſees, inſtructs, mounts t'heaven;
the Angels charge: Matthi' joyn'd with th'eleven.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: By Spirits deſcent they ſpeak tongues; maintain'd
be,
thouſands turn'd, baptiz'd, their care, unity.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Cur'd's the cripple by Chriſts pow'r, Peter ſaith:
exhorts Chriſts killers to repentance, faith.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Dragg'd he and John to Gaol are, ſilenc'd be:
are bold, pray, the room ſhakes; Church unity.

lg.label: chapter 5
lg.l: Expires Sapphir': Apoſtles wonders do;
ſhut up, by Angel freed, Gamaliel too.

lg.label: chapter 6
lg.l: For the poors good th'Apoſtles Deacons chuſe:
Stephen confutes the Jews; they him abuſe.

lg.label: chapter 7
lg.l: Gives anſwer; Chriſt doth preach, them murd'rers call:
they ſtone him: he dying prays for them all.

lg.label: chapter 8
lg.l: Here Stephen's mourn'd; Church ſcatt'red, converts fram'd,
Samaritans, Eunuch turn'd: Magus blam'd.

lg.label: chapter 9
lg.l: Jeſus calls Saul: Jews ſeek his death therefore:
Aeneas, Dorcas, Peter doth reſtore.

lg.label: chapter 10
lg.l: Know Peters viſion here; Cornelius call,
he preacheth Chriſt: the Sp'rit deſcends on all.

lg.label: chapter 11
lg.l: Laid's this to Peter, clear'd is; Goſpel ſpread:
who firſt call'd Chriſtians; Jews Saints relieved.

lg.label: chapter 12
lg.l: Murd'red is James; Peter in priſon lies:
an Angel frees him: by lice Herod dies.

lg.label: chapter 13
lg.l: Nations Saul's ſent to, call'd Paul, Elimas blind
is: Jews gainſay: 'Antiochites faith finde.

lg.label: chapter 14
lg.l: Outrage Iconians do: Paul, Barnabas,
a Lyſtrian cripple heal; for Gods they paſs.
Oh ſudden change, Pauls ſton'd, he firms the Saints
at Antioch; how God proſp'red them, acquaints.

lg.label: chapter 15
lg.l: Preſs'd circumciſion; the church clears the doubt:
Barnabas and Paul part, but firſt fall out.

lg.label: chapter 16
lg.l: Quick's Pauls remove when Tim's cut: Pythoniſt
cur'd: Lydia, Gaoler, do believe in Chriſt.

lg.label: chapter 17
lg.l: Reaching Theſſaly, ſome rage, ſome faith ſhow;
Bereans prais'd: Athens unknown God know.

lg.label: chapter 18
lg.l: Saul wrought, taught at Corinth: Gallio his ſoes
curbs: taught's Apollo, who doth Jews oppoſe.

lg.label: chapter 19
lg.l: The Sp'rit Paul gives: Jews rage, Exorciſts bruſht
are: wonders wrought, Books burnt, crafts-mens trade cruſht.

lg.label: chapter 20
lg.l: Viewing Troas, Paul Eutychus doth raiſe:
his ſuff'rings, Elders duty ſhews; parts, prays:

lg.label: chapter 21
lg.l: All warninings work not, Paul to Salem goes:
his life endanger'd, reſcu'd is from foes.

lg.label: chapter 22
lg.l: Bold's Paul to ſhew his life, call; Jews outcry:
ſcourging he ſcapes by Romes immunity.

lg.label: chapter 23
lg.l: Check Paul doth the Prieſt for his blow, his foes
diſſent, his death vow'd, Lyſias frees from thoſe.

lg.label: chapter 24
lg.l: Drawn is Tertullus charge: Pauls anſwer's ſound:
he bribes not, Felix goes out; Pauls left bound.

lg.label: chapter 25
lg.l: Exclaim'd he is to Feſtus, his appeal:
Feſtus it to Agrippa doth reveal.

lg.label: chapter 26
lg.l: From childhood Paul his ſtate ſhews, mad is thought,
cauſleſs; Agrippa near a Chriſtian wrought.

lg.label: chapter 27
lg.l: Going to Rome Pauls ſhip a tempeſt great
meets; wrackt is, all the men to land ſafe get.

lg.label: chapter 28
lg.l: He finds Malta's men kinde, burns viper, heals:
to Rome goes,: why he's come, and Chriſt reveals.

div.head: The Epiſtle of Paul To the ROMANS.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: APprove doth Paul his Call: Rome prays to ſee;
the Goſpels power: with ſin God is angry.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: Blame who do others can't themſelves excuſe:
to circumciſe profits nor Greeks nor Jews.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Convince of ſin the Law doth; no man juſt
by Law, but faith: the Law continue muſt.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Deem'd's Abr'am juſt by faith, promiſe receives;
wee're juſt by faith, he's his Sire who believes.

lg.label: chapter 5
lg.l: Each faithful by Chriſts blood hath peace: Joys in
hope: by Chriſt life came, as by Adam ſin.

lg.label: chapter 6
lg.l: Fly ſin if dead to't, baptiſm doth declare:
ſerve not ſin, if in Chriſt; what ſins hires are.

lg.label: chapter 7
lg.l: Good is the Law; on dead ones hath no might;
we're dead to it: our luſts againſt grace fight.

lg.label: chapter 8
lg.l: Here ſigns and good of grace, here fleſh harms
are;
Saints freedom long'd, from Gods love nought
them bar.

lg.label: chapter 9
lg.l: Jews ſtate grieves Paul; the promiſe: heirs not all:
Gods choice free, Jews caſt off: why? Gentiles call.

lg.label: chapter 10
lg.l: Know how faith differs from works by the word:
all faithful ſav'd: Gentiles ſhall finde the Lord.

lg.label: chapter 11
lg.l: Lo ſome Jews choſen are, boaſt not 'gainſt thoſe
(Gentiles;) ther's hope of more: Gods ways are
cloſe.

lg.label: chapter 12
lg.l: Mercies obedience call; attend your place:
ſelf-conceit and revenge flee, love embrace.

lg.label: chapter 13
lg.l: Necks bow to the high Pow'rs: love doth fulfil
the Law; night works with Goſpel-times ſuit ill.

lg.label: chapter 14
lg.l: Object not 'gainſt men for indiff'rencies:
give not offence, this prov'd unlawful is.

lg.label: chapter 15
lg.l: Praiſe not ſelf: bear with weak; receive ye all,
as Chriſt did: Paul doth for their prayers call.

lg.label: chapter 16
lg.l: Quartus, with more, greeted; Paul wills take heed
of falſe Teachers, who do diviſions breed.

div.head: The Firſt Epiſtle of Paul To the CORINTHIANS.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: AFter ſalutes, Paul calls for unity:
God the weak chuſeth, ſleights the wiſe, mighty.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: By humane gifts his preaching excels not
but Gods pow'r: By nature Goſpel's not got.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Chriſt babes have milk: ſtrife is from fleſh; Paul plants,
God bleſs. the baſis Chriſt; Gods houſe: All's Saints.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Deem Paſtors ſtewards: their all receive they;
though counted filth, are fathers, them obey.

lg.label: chapter 5
lg.l: Extracteth ſhame not joy th'inceſtuous:
old leaven purge; ſhun offenders hainous.

lg.label: chapter 6
lg.l: Forbid is Lawing, from Heav'n barr'd unjuſt:
our bodies why not be defiled muſt.

lg.label: chapter 7
lg.l: Good rules about wedlock, virginity:
contented be with your ſtate; whoredom fly.

lg.label: chapter 8
lg.l: Heed take of Idol-meats; offences fly.
your freedom, knowledge, curb with charity.

lg.label: chapter 9
lg.l: Joyn'd's not Paul to a wife, works; others free
are, may of Goſpel live: of mans race ſee.

lg.label: chapter 10
lg.l: Know Jews rites, types of ours: plagu'd for our ſake
they are: Let's not Chriſts table Satans make.

lg.label: chapter 11
lg.l: Let women vail heads praying, men be bare.
in coming to Chriſts Table take great care.

lg.label: chapter 12
lg.l: Many are Chriſts gifts for profit, but one
his body, like natures; all gifts have none.

lg.label: chapter 13
lg.l: Nothing all gifts are without charity:
above faith, hope, love hath ſupremacie.

lg.label: chapter 14
lg.l: Of tongues propheſie takes place, their uſe ſee,
abuſe: Let women in Church ſilent be.

lg.label: chapter 15
lg.l: Prov'd's our riſing: gain-ſayers overthrown.
The fru • t, manners, ſurvivers change is ſhown.

lg.label: chapter 16
lg.l: Quickned they are the poor Saints to ſupply;
watch; Elders obey: prais'd is Timothy.

div.head: The Second Epiſtle of Paul To the CORINTHIANS.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: ARm Paul doth Corinth 'gainſt anxiety
with comfort; ſhews he preached ſincerely.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: Brought's his not coming cauſe; they comfort, favour
muſt th'outcaſt penitent: Paul's a ſweet ſavour.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Commended's Pauls Miniſt'ry; compar'd are
Law, Goſpel-Miniſtry: laſt exceeds far.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Diligent, ſincere's Paul: his ſufferings tend
to Gods praiſe, Churches good, his, without end.

lg.label: chapter 5
lg.l: Enſur'd of Heav'n, waiting dooms-day, Paul
lives,
as from Chriſt, in good conſcience, their peace ſtrives.

lg.label: chapter 6
lg.l: Faithful is Paul: his various ſuff'rings ſee:
Saints are Gods houſe, unequal yoaking flee.

lg.label: chapter 7
lg.l: Go on in grace: their grief to their good turn'd;
Paul's glad for't: Titus with good news return'd.

lg.label: chapter 8
lg.l: Here Macedonians and Chriſt patterns are
for their bounty: Paul commends Titus for's care.

lg.label: chapter 9
lg.l: Inform'd they're, why Titus is ſent before:
free givers, free have; God is prais'd therefore.

lg.label: chapter 10
lg.l: Keen are Pauls ſpir'tual arms foes to reſiſt:
abſent, preſent the ſame; vaunting deſiſt.

lg.label: chapter 11
lg.l: Lauds Paul himſelf in ſuff'ring; preaching free▪
behind true, falſe Apoſtles, is not be.

lg.label: chapter 12
lg.l: Might he in fights boaſt, he'l not, but weakneſs:
his ſeeking them, not theirs, doth love expreſs.

lg.label: chapter 13
lg.l: Not ſpare will Paul th'obdurate, bids them prove
their faith; prays for them, calls for peace and love.

div.head: The Epiſtle of Paul to the GALATIANS.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: ADmir'd's their revolt: curſt falſe teachers are;
his Goſpel from God: his call, life after.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: By works none juſt made, but faith; Titus not
circumcis'd: blam'd is Peters halting ſpot.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Craves Paul why faith is left on Law to reſt:
faithful are juſtifi'd, with Abr'am bleſt.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Deliver from the Law doth Chriſt his Saints;
free-womans ſeed: of their love chang'd his plaints.

lg.label: chapter 5
lg.l: Enfranchis'd from the Law, ſtand faſt, but love.
the Spirits fruits, fleſh-works, in the Spirit move.

lg.label: chapter 6
lg.l: Frailties how to bear with, burdens bear; be
to teachers free: In Chriſts croſs ſole vaunts he.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: ADopt, elect by grace, (fountain of bleſs)
we are: he prays they may Chriſt know, poſſeſs.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: By nature and grace what we are; we're made
for good works: let's as Saints (not Heathen) trade.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Gall of Gentiles Paul knew, (though bid of old,)
to preach it: prays they may Chriſts love behold.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Divers gifts giv'n, why: live in unity:
put on new man; ſhun tongues impurity.

lg.label: chapter 5
lg.l: Eſchew luſts, looſe words, and companions:
be wary, thankful; rules for married ones.

lg.label: chapter 6
lg.l: Father, childe, Maſter, man, learn his part may:
mans war and arms; ſtand faſt, and win the day.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: A Pray'r and thanks for the Philippians: Pauls
ſuff'rings-fruit, ſtrait for love, courage he calls.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: Be one, humble as Chriſt: In his way go,
with fear: walk as worlds light, his joy alſo.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Cautious of dogs be; truſt not fleſh: count all
dung for Chriſt: ſeek the mark; fly ways carnal.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Decline cares, rejoyce, mod'rate, thankful be;
Pauls content, can do all, be full, hungry.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: AFter thanks for their grace, its ſtrength Paul prays:
Preacheth Chriſt, him receive: ſtand firm always.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: Blot out are legal rites: of them beware;
cleave cloſe to Chriſt, in him compleat ye are.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Chriſt where to ſeek; kill earthly limbs, ſhun lyes:
put on Chriſt; love chiefly: divers duties.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Devotion-rules; walk wiſely; ſpeak with grace:
Epaphras's zeal: Archippus heed thy place.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: ALl times Paul for the Theſſalonians prays,
& gives thanks; their faith is ſincere he ſays.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: Brought taught how the Goſpel was to them, and
receiv'd, his coming Satan did withſtand.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Choice love ſhews he in ſending Timothy,
in's prayers, joy, for their faith, charity.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Drive on in grace, love, holineſs, allay
grief for the dead; ſet forth is judgment day.

lg.label: chapter 5
lg.l: Enlarg'd this further is, exhorts to know
Gods workmen; many duties more doth ſhow,

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: ACt thanks doth Paul for their faith, patience,
love: God them, and their foes will recompence.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: Be ſtedfaſt in the truth; ſome 'fore laſt day
ſhall it leave: Antichriſt Paul doth diſplay.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Craving their prayers, he for them doth pray,
'gainſt idlers treats: note them who diſobey.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: ADviſe Tim. Paul doth: the Laws uſe and end:
Of Pauls call; he doth two to Satan ſend.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: Bids pray for all; womens attiring ſee:
their ſilence; muſt not teach; yet ſav'd may be.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Clergy-men and their wives, their Quality:
of Godlineſs great is the myſtery.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Depart fron the faith ſome ſhall in laſt days;
precepts for Miniſters he theme diſplays.

lg.label: chapter 5
lg.l: Edicts for reproofs, widows, Elders; take
a little wine Tim. may for his health ſake.

lg.label: chapter 6
lg.l: For ſervants rules; new Teachers all muſt heed;
wealth-love's a ſnare; what men muſt do and read.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: APplauded is Tim's faith; he muſt excite
Gods gift, ſtand firm; hold the form of ſound Writ.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: Be ſtrong, bear hardneſs, prophane babblings fly;
youthful luſts, ſtrife, keep faith, peace, unity.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Come will, deſcrib'd are, truths foes, in laſt days:
Paul gives himſelf a pattern: Scriptures praiſe.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Duties of Miniſters, Pauls death's at hand:
Demas revolt: the Lord by Paul did ſtand.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: AT Crete why Titus left: the Quality
of Biſhops: ſtop falſe Teachers; their ways ſee.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: Both for life, Doctrine, Paul him rules doth give:
ſervants duty: how all Saints ought to live.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Counſel doth Paul, what Titus ought to teach;
when he muſt come: 'gainſt Hereticks to preach.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: APplaud doth Paul Philemons faith and love:
Bids him forgive his ſervant, & him prove.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: APproaching to us Chriſt, promoted is
above Angels in Perſon and Office.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: Becauſe Chriſt did of our natures receive,
we ought not of obedience him bereave.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Chriſt Moſes doth excel: a greater pain,
than hardned Iſrael, the faithleſs ſhall gain.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: During reſt faith obtains, the words power ſhown;
by our High-Prieſt we muſt go to Gods throne.

lg.label: chapter 5
lg.l: Excel Chriſts Prieſthood doth in pow'r and fame;
neglect of knowledg thereof he doth blame.

lg.label: chapter 6
lg.l: From falling back he warns, conſtant to be,
waiting on God for his oaths certainty.

lg.label: chapter 7
lg.l: Greatly Melchiſedeks Order did ſurpaſs
Aarons Prieſthood; Chriſt of this order was.

lg.label: chapter 8
lg.l: Here Chriſts Prieſthood Levies Prieſthood expels;
th'eternal Cov'nant the Legal excels.

lg.label: chapter 9
lg.l: Inferiour Legal Sacrifices are
to the perfection of Chriſts blood by far.

lg.label: chapter 10
lg.l: Kill'd ſin is by Chriſts death; Law doth remain
weak: we muſt faith with patience retain.

lg.label: chapter 11
lg.l: Lo what faith is: ſans faith no pleaſing God:
what old Saints did, who in faiths path have trod.

lg.label: chapter 12
lg.l: Mov'd we are to faith, patience, godlineſs:
th'Old Teſtament than new is prized leſs.

lg.label: chapter 13
lg.l: New Doctrines ſhun, avarice; prize honeſt life,
love Gods Preachers: own Chriſt, let alms be rife.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: ASk patience, joy in croſſes: with ſin ſtain
not God; do Gods word, elſe Religion's vain.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: Be to rich, poor, alike: let love abound;
faith without works, dead, dev'liſh will be found.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Correct not others raſhly, curb the tongue;
the truly wiſe are mild, not doing wrong.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Diſdain avarice, pride, ill ſpeaking, luſt:
minde thine end; God, not riches make thy truſt.

lg.label: chapter 5
lg.l: Evils haunt rich miſers, be patient: flee
ſwearing: confeſs, ſing, pray, when: its force ſee.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: ADoption thank'd for is: Saints joy when bleed:
muſt holy be, of old Chriſt's ſhewn, decreed.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: Breaches of love; luſts flee, your baſis ſure
is Chriſt; obey Pow'rs; Maſters wrongs endure.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Commands for wives and husbands; love all ought
and ſuffer: what fruit Chriſt to th' Old World brought.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Depart from ſin, the Judgment Day draws nigh:
he comforts them againſt anxiety.

lg.label: chapter 5
lg.l: Elders muſt feed their flocks, younger obey;
watch, and be ſober, reſiſt Satans ſway.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: APproaching death, Peter bids make Call ſure;
hold faſt the faith, let it in minde endure.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: Beware of Hereticks, their judgment's ſhown:
good men them ſhun, their ways here may be known.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Chriſt comes: Saints muſt repent; the world be 'ſtroy'd,
the manner; it expect: all ſins avoid.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: A Good life proves with Chriſt our fellowſhip;
confeſs ſin, God forgives: none but doth ſlip.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: Behold the Advocate; of hate; world's love:
of Antichriſt; from him the Saints ſafe prove.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Childſhip ſhews Gods love; his Sons him obey:
each other love; compaſſion do diſplay.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Diſtinguiſh thoſe who boaſt of Spirit, by
the word; inducements to love Brotherly.

lg.label: chapter 5
lg.l: Each loving God loves his; ſans grief obeys;
Chriſt can him ſave, and hear, who to him prays.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: A Lady John doth warn, conſtant to be;
not loſe her reward: falſe Teachers to flee.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: APplaud doth John Gaius truth, bounty: blame
Diotrephes: Demetrius his fame.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: SEducers Jude deſcribes, their fall declares:
how we, and others, may eſcape their ſnares.

lg.label: chapter 1
lg.l: ASias ſeven Churches John writes to: ſhewn by
ſeven Candleſticks: Chriſts coming, Majeſty.

lg.label: chapter 2
lg.l: Both virtues and vices of Epheſus,
of Smyrna, Thiatira, Pergamus.

lg.label: chapter 3
lg.l: Checkt's Sardis: Philadelphia's praiſe; at door
Chriſt knocks: Laodicea's luke-warm, poor.

lg.label: chapter 4
lg.l: Diſcern'd's Gods Throne, the Elders twenty four;
th'ey'd Beaſts; Elders caſt crowns down, him adore.

lg.label: chapter 5
lg.l: Enſeal'd Book none but ſlain Lamb open can:
th' Elders praiſe him for their redemption.

lg.label: chapter 6
lg.l: the horſes, judgments, and the laſt Judgment.

lg.label: chapter 7
lg.l: Gods Saints ſeal'd ſumm'd, who before his Throne ſtood
with palms in hand, robes waſht in the Lambs blood.

lg.label: chapter 8
lg.l: Here ſev'nth ſeal's rent, aſcend Saints prayers, incenſe;
four Angels trumpets ſound, plagues follow thence.

lg.label: chapter 9
lg.l: In fifth ſound a Star falls; open'd is hells pit:
Locuſts come: th' ſixth ſound, bound Angels free ſet.

lg.label: chapter 10
lg.l: Kend's a ſtrong Angel with o'pe book in hands;
ſwears, time's no more; to eat it John commands.

lg.label: chapter 11
lg.l: Limits of Temple mete; witneſſes ſlain;
revive: the ſeventh trump ſounds, and Chriſt doth reign.

lg.label: chapter 12
lg.l: Michael beats the Dragon, who would kill
the womans childe: ſhe flies; he ſeeks her ill.

lg.label: chapter 13
lg.l: Now ten-horn'd beaſt receives from dragon power
a two-horn'd beaſt comes; men the firſt adore

lg.label: chapter 14
lg.l: On Zion ſtands the Lamb: the Goſpel's preacht.
Babels fall; worlds harveſt Gods vintage teacht.

lg.label: chapter 15
lg.l: Plagues ſev'n laſt, with ſev'n Angels; ſongs of thoſe
that foil the beaſt; ſev'n vials 'gainſt Gods foes.

lg.label: chapter 16
lg.l: Quilted with wrath Gods vials Angels pour
our; then plagues: Chriſt comes: bleſt who watch the hour.

lg.label: chapter 17
lg.l: Ride ſcarlet woman doth on Babels beaſt;
ſev'n heads ſhewn, horns ten: whore whipt; Lambs conqueſt.

lg.label: chapter 18
lg.l: Stout Babels fall; come forth muſt Saints: earths Kings,
merchants, and Saylers mourn; Saints joy thence ſprings.

lg.label: chapter 19
lg.l: Thank God, whore's judg'd: Saints blood 'veng'd, the Lambs wed;
Angel ſtays worſhip; fowls muſt eat the dead.

lg.label: chapter 20
lg.l: Vile Satan's bound, how long; when loos'd again:
the firſt and laſt riſing; Gog, Magog, ſlain.

lg.label: chapter 21
lg.l: A new heav'n, earth, Jeruſalem is ſhewn;
Gods glory lights her; by Kings rich ſhe's grown.

lg.label: chapter 22
lg.l: Brook, tree of life, his Cities light the Lord:
th'Angel ſtops worſhip, add not to Gods word.

div.head: The Order, and Time, wherein the Penmen of the New Teſtament wrote.

lg.l: THe time each Goſpel's penn'd, men diſagree;
What is receiv'd by moſt, here you may ſee.
The ninth year after Chriſts aſſcent, Matthew
Wrote his Goſpel; Mark after him years two.
Luke wrote in the fifteenth after Chriſts death:
But John in Patmos, the two and thirtieth.
The Acts Luke penn'd in Chriſts fiftieth year,
At Rome, when Paul remain'd a priſoner.
The order of th'Epiſtles next comes in:
With Pauls, before his bonds, we will begin.
The firſt to Theſſalonians write did Paul
from Corinth, the ſeventeenth year of his call.
The ſecond ſhortly after he did ſend
from thence (as that) by Tychicus his friend.
From Macedon his firſt to Timothy,
in the nineteenth year of Pauls Miniſt'ry.
From Epheſus the ſixty fouerth year
of Chriſt, Corinthians firſt written to were.
The ſecond ſhortly after written was
at Philippi, ſent by Titus, Lucas.
Paul from Nicopolis wrote to Titus,
in his two years abode at Epheſus.
To Rome, from Corinth, ſhortly ere he went
to 'Salem, where ſeiz'd on, to Rome he's ſent.

In his firſt b •…
Pauls▪ the Hebrews wrote
from Rome: his ſecond bonds thoſe next begot:
To •… e Galatians, and Epheſians,
Shortly before his death to Timothy
His ſecond, in the year of Chriſt ſixty.
James Alpheus wrote after Here •… es
Were grown, before Jeruſalems miſeries▪
Peter his firſt wrote to diſperſed Jews
In Babylon, Chaldea, after news
That Antioch had the faith receiv'd. His laſt
A little before he of death did taſte.
Johns firſt Epiſtle's penn'd when he is old,
At Epheſus, when Hereticks grew bold:
His ſecond, to the choice Lady, decries
Baſilides, who Chriſts manhood denies.
His third, to Gaius, whence, when, is unknown:
In Patmos Iſle the Revelation
He wrote, whil'ſt baniſht by Domitian.
Jude did in Perſia write, after began
To ſpread the Hereticks Simonian.

div.head: The Deaths of the twelve Apoſtles.
div.l: ANdrew, Zelotes, Philip, and Peter
(With his head downward) crucified were.
James (Zebedeus Son) with Matthias,
Beheaded were. The other James thrown was
Down rudely from the Temples battlement;
Ston'd, and ſlain with a fullers inſtrument.
Lebbeus with a ſword, a ſpear Matthew:
Club-beaten, skinn'd, crucifi'd Barth'lomew.
Thomas with a dart's ſlain. John liv'd to ſee
Ninety nine years; then in peace died he.

div.head: A Chronology of Years, from the Creation, to the Deſtruction of Jeruſalem by Titus Veſpaſian.

row.cell:
Shem was born, Gen. 5.32. with cap. 7,6 ca. 8.13. ca. 11.10.
Though it is ſaid, Gen. 5.32. that Noah was 500 years old, and begat Shem, Ham, and Japhet, the meaning is not, that they were all born at a birth, but that then he began to beget. Now that Shem was not born before two years after, appears, in that it is ſaid, Gen. 11.10. That Shem at one hundred years old begat Arphaxad, two years after the flood. And Gen. 7.6. that Noah was 600 years old when the flood came.

Abraham was born,
Abraham could not be the eldeſt Son though he be placed firſt, Gen. 11.26 but he was born 60 years after; as appears by comparing Gen. 11.32. with c. 12.4. whereby it appears, that Terah lived 200 and five years, at whoſe death Abraham was ſeventy five years old; which being ſubſtracted from 205. there remains 130.
The Covenant was made with Abraham, Gen. 12.4.
Eſau and Jacob were born, Gen. 25.26.

Jacob went down into Egypt, Gen. 47.9
At this time Joſeph was 39 years old, viz. at his ſale into Egypt, 17 years, Gen. 37.2. when he ſtood before Pharaoh, 30 year • , Gen. 41▪46.
When Jacob came to Egypt, 39 years, for the ſeven years of plenty, and two of famine were paſt, Gen. 45.6. ſo as
Joſeph was born when Jacob was 91 years old.

Joſeph died, Gen. 50.26.
Which is cleare • thus; Joſeph was at his fathers coming into Egypt (as before) 39 years: Jacob lived in Egypt 17 years, Gen. 47.28. ſo as, at his father death he was 54 years, that is, in all, 110 years, Gen▪ 50.26. Add the 17 and 54 together, it maketh 71.
Moſes was born. This is proved after.

Iſrael went up out of Egypt when Moſes was 80 years old, Exod. 7.7.
This muſt be ſo, becauſe he lived in all but 120 years, whereof 40 were ſpent in the wilderneſs, Deut. 34.7. with cap. 29.5.
So as from the Covenant made with Abraham, to the Iſraelites coming up out of Egypt, is 430 years, according to that in Gen. 12.41. with Gal. 3.17. which proves the time between the death of Joſeph to the birth of Moſes to be 64 years.
The Iſraelites entred into Canaan under the conduct of Joſhuah, Joſh. 5.6.
Deborah judged Iſrael 40 years, Judg. 5.31. cap. 4.4.
